description:
This place was very conveniently located a short few blocks from the CPMC Davies campus hospital in San Francisco.

I made several trips for lunches over a 4 day period while my wife was recovering from surgery.

Every thing I ordered, from hot to cold sandwiches, salad and onion rings was very good. The salad ingrediants were exceptionally fresh. 

With all the eggs they use, it would be great to see an egg salad sandwich on the menu. However I guess the owner is not keen on that idea. To bad, it would probably be an awesome sandwich!
author: Don M.

description: I come here to work regularly, it's a great place to work from, good wifi, outlets against the wall.  The food isn't anything too special but I somehow like that about it, it's simple food done well.  Coffee it great, and not overpriced, which is what matters most to me.  Also a great location with good natural light (I sometimes spend the whole day working here so this helps).
author: Rachel M.

description:
The Grind is a long-standing institution of Lower Haight. Even today, with the influx of some new businesses further east on Haight St, the Grind is still one of the only places that is reliable for all your coffee, tea, and breakfast needs. 

As a vegan, there is unfortunately not a whole lot of options at your disposal. However, you can find a tofu scramble, some hummus and bagel type offerings, as well as soy and almond milk on the menu. I believe they also occasionally have some vegan baked good selections, although I didn't see any last time I was there.

Although the vegan options aren't stellar, it's about on par with most of the rest of the neighborhood (or even SF, for that matter.) But I personally really appreciate that they have a large selection of teas. For some reason, it's rather difficult to find hot tea offerings in the area. Most of the cafes in the neighborhood tend to be very coffee centric. The Grind carries Mighty Leaf and have all of your staple varieties (plus a little more.)

Finally, the Grind is a place you actually want to hang out at and spend a little bit of your morning and afternoon. The staff is friendly and they have a good amount of seating both indoors and out. If outdoors, you get the bonus of people/bike watching on Haight St.
author: Jon T.

description:
Amazing breakfast burrito!

Most Saturdays, I have to spring for takeout brunch, and the Grind's breakfast burrito is one of my go-tos. Love the chorizo burrito. It's giant, packed with fresh ingredients, and tastes even better when you ask them to put the hash brown (included with your burrito!) into the burrito itself. Such a great combination of flavors and textures.

I never finish, so I'd recommend getting the burrito to share if you're not ravenously hungry.
author: Kelly R.

description: Hearty cafe food. Had the pancakes, which weren't very good, unless you like rubbery dough. Waiter quite rude. In an area inundated with high quality foodstuffs, this is the very essence of mediocrity.
author: Mike J.

description:
I placed my order via Postmates and didn't receive my complete order. I called the restaurant and was immediately put off by the attitude of the person who answered. Almost to the point where I'm arguing about my missing bagel and cream cheese!  

The restaurant took No responsibility Even if it was Not Their mistake (according to the rude staff member). There was another person who must've overheard the poor customer service and they took over the call.  Still, blaming me for my order. She then wanted me to read her my receipt and I told her that I only had the visa slip charge and not an itemized one. I then had to ask for the owners name and his hours and was given the run around again. 

Absolutely Horrible customer service. Food=couldn't even eat! Disgusted by the way I was treated.
author: Monica B.

description: Cool place to chill and have brunch.  Killer croissant french toast.  Desserts yo die for, try the lemon bread (cake).   Staff is cool, I'm a fan - just do it.
author: Christian C.

description: Today was the third time that the kitchen has forgotten to make my order.By the time that they did make it, they added in everything that I asked them not to and did not include everything that I paid  extra for to be added to my dish.  I finally received my food 40 minutes after I ordered it and it was overcooked. We eat here a few times a month because we live close by but won't be returning.  I gave two stars for the nice people who take the order. It should not be that hard to read what the ticket in front of you says to prepare and you should not make your regular customers wait 40 minutes when you are not that busy. Bye Felicia
author: Jess B.

description:
Wow, this place has reviews all over the place, from 1 star to 5 stars. I've walked by this place many times, figured I'd give it a try.  Was 9 am on a Sunday morning, only a few folks here, could easily pick your table.  Menu on the wall, order from the cashier, food brought to your table. There's plenty of outdoor seating as well.

I opted for the De Lox Omelet (fresh lox, tomato, green onion and cream cheese topped with capers--from the menu), $13.50 plus tax.

See attached piks. Omelet was chock full of lox. Those capers it was suppose to be "topped with" were absent. Would have liked to have seen more cream cheese, but all in all, made for a decent rendition, did miss the capers. The potatoes were good, not the best I've ever had, but decent. From ordering to receiving my food, took no more than 10 minutes.   

Got much busier by the end of my meal, a line started to form, including families with children.

Based on what I ordered, and didn't try anything else, was a solid breakfast.
author: Steve M.

description: Had a great experience in this little cafe while I visited for San Francisco Pride. The employees were so polite, and the food was delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced. If you're looking for a great breakfast place, definitely try this place!
author: Ahmad M.

description:
Yaaasss. I guess three visits makes me both a local and a regular. 

I would argue that a true Sunday requires three key ingredients: cheap mimosas, delicious brunch foods (though I could eat brunch daily), and happy people. The grind has the perfect trifecta. 

A plate of almost anything tends to come in at around $11 and the mimosas are about a fiver. I've had the scramble a few times and it's huge, at least, by my standards. The Benedict was grand, although my memory for how good is poor. I'm pretty sure I enjoyed it. I have decided next time that I'll pass on the homefries, since I just can't ever get through all that food. If you're a hungry one, know that you'll be fed. And fed.

The inside-outside seating is a good vantage point for looking at cute neighbourhood dogs (and their owners, I guess) and I've seen plenty of cool characters walking by. One guy was in full clown shoes, which was a delight. Another guy was sat eating brunch accompanied by his pet iguana. I desperately wanted to pet it, but I did not. I fear it may have been rude to interrupt.

Fantastic place. The staff are fab, too.
author: Rowena H.

description: Every time I'm in the city, I stop here for a bite to eat! They have the best food.. hands down. Everything I have ordered has been so fresh and cooked perfectly! Also, awesome customer service which is rare these days! I will continue to support this business.
author: Ki Ki G.

description:
The food here is pretty tasty. Everything has great flavor. I had the chicken pesto sandwich and really liked it. Their salads are good too. I'd recommend the pear salad. 
Fries are separate from the burger. I was disappointed with the fry portion. I ate them in probably two bites :( .
They have wifi here. 
Nice spot. I've had luck with parking here.
I would recommend it. It's a bit pricey though. $12 for a sandwich. $12 for a salad
author: Kevin S.

description: I usually hit this place up when I didn't have time to grab breakfast at home and need a quick bite.  There is usually only one person at the register who also serves beverages/coffee, so even if the line is short, it may take a while to order.  I suggest for those in a hurry to call your order in ahead of time.  I have ordered a variety of breakfast items here and overall the food is just average.  For me this place is more about convenience than an amazing meal.  Service is average and prices are reasonable.
author: Andrea B.

description: This place is disgusting! There was a LIVE cockroach, having a field day in the pear salad. Do order in nor to go. This place doesn't deserve people's hard earned money.
author: Connie C.

description: This place is decent. The food is good- not great. We work nearby and have been coming here for over 10 years. Yes, we keep coming back, but in 10 years, they have never once gotten an order completely correct. We always ask for no onions, or a diet Coke, syrup for our pancakes- etc. they always forget something. The prices have gone steadily up, and the service has remained the same.  Often the prices are higher than what you see online. Just beware. It's not a deal breaker (obviously) but it can be very frustrating.
author: Kim K.

description: Tasty, unpretentious, solidly good breakfast/brunch/lunch spot. The omelette and hash browns are well portioned. Love the breakfast sandwich and the lox -- hard to find hearty breakfasts like this in the city!
author: Stephanie S.

description: Disappointed to see this place continue to raise prices. Not everyone in SF can afford a $40 breakfast for two
author: McLain K.

description: Just as bad as it was 7 years ago when I was last in. Forgettable food and extremely slow (45 minutes for a sandwich).
author: Captain B.

description:
While every other restaurant in the city allows your dog on the outdoor patio, this one will throw you out halfway through your meal and claim that it's "city law". I called the city and they say it's legal for dogs to be on outdoor patios in restaurants.

I don't go to restaurants that lie about their policies and try to blame it on someone else. If you hate dogs so much that you won't allow them on your outdoor patio, I don't want to support your business.
author: Philip D.

description:
I usually like to order Chicken Fried Steak or the Asian Chicken Salad. Both are very good and satisfying. 

Asian Chicken Salad has shredded chicken and mandarin oranges in them. Dressing is usually mixed in which I appreciate. 

Chicken Fried Steak is really filling and yummy. 

I've also gotten the Mocha Smoothie and Pineapple Coconut Smoothie and they're both really yummy. I think they are pretty pricey for the size of the cup. I wish they had bigger cups because I slurp them down so quickly!!
author: Carmina D.

description: The food here is very good. Omelettes, french dip sandwich, grilled chicken sandwich. The only issue I have is their lettuce is ALWAYS old. I stopped ordering the side salad since it's so constant.  Please get a new lettuce vendor!
author: R A.

description:
LOVED this place!!! Very friendly service! 
Great menu selection! Full on coffee selection as well! Had a delicious latte and  the most amazing scrambled spinach and feta egg! Hash browns cooked to perfection! Also have a section with a lot of baked goodies. Yum! May have to hit this spot again before we leave.
author: Diana E.

description: A modern cafe in the midst of an old town Lower Haight. I had the peanut butter and banana waffles with fruit and OJ and my boyfriend had a combo with toast eggs and potatoes. Both of our meals were delicious and was prepared quickly. The service was good and I'd happily return on my next visit to SF.
author: Andrea M.

description: Wow. What a joke this place is. Stood in line for 40 minutes. Right when we got to the front, one register broke. How convenient. Now we wait longer because only one person manning the second register. At this point we decided to just get the food to go. I order a pear salad, honey mustard dressing on side. Husband orders veggie melt. More waiting. I see our take out food just sitting on the counter and wait some more. No one gave it us until I asked. Phew, get me out of here already. Go to the car. Open up the food...salad, no honey mustard dressing. Veggie melt...let's just say it looked worse than jail food. They wouldn't even serve this at the fyre festival. The cheese came out of a cheese wiz can. Biggest joke of a place and waste of money. Oh, bring blue bottle to the lower haight :)
author: Karley A.

description: We were looking for a place to eat near CPMC (hospital). We were pleasantly surprised with this place. My aunt had the Scott Street Omlett and they did not skimp on the filling. My mom had a Belgium waffel with strawberries/bananas drizzled with Nutella which was presented beautifully. I had the BLTA on toasted sourdough with fries which really hit the spot. The food was great and the employees we're very friendly. I checked out the food that other people had sitting around us. It all looked very appetizing;  burgers, salads, bagels, breakfast, gormet coffees, teas. I have no idea why anybody would give this place less than 3 stars even if they were having a bad day.
author: Donna P.

description: Finally made it back here today, and the 4 stars remain. I had a delicious and fresh-tasting Beet Salad that included mandarins, cranberries, walnuts, and goat cheese. And a cup of joe. Surprisingly filling meal, the salad was pretty big. I'll stop there again... hopefully can make it a regular stop.
author: James P.

description:
The food is great. There are so many menu options! The service is great as well. I love the ambience early on a Saturday morning: the music, the calmness, etc.

This place is awesome. I wish I lived here haha
author: Bri C.

description:
Food is pretty solid but staff consistently acts like they are being bothered when you are ordering or asking questions. I've come here many times due to its proximity to my apartment and continue to give it one chance too many. They've messed up call-in orders several times after I took care to be explicit around the order, knowing that they had messed it up before. 

Today was the last straw where I came in on a Monday to catch up on some emails and have some lunch. I clearly had my laptop with me and we'll after I ordered and asked why the wi-fi wasn't connecting, they flippantly told me it wasn't on today. I know the policy is no weekend wi-fi but they offered no explanation and there were no signs etc. Had to scarf down my meal and head somewhere else that abides by their own website's wi-fi policy. Burned by this place in so many ways so many times, so thought I would share to help others.
author: Tom M.

description:
Bad service ruined our breakfast. 

New Years Day, lunchtime. Spousal-Unit ordered the steak and eggs, medium rare. Counter-girl repeated "medium rare" and Spousal-Unit repeated "medium rare."  I asked for a burger. 

The food came out within a reasonable period. 

My burger was really good. Spousal-Unit's steak was small, but not a bad deal at $13.50. He took a small bite of it. Then he cut and offered a bite to me as he was still chewing. I took the bite he proffered. As we were chewing it, we looked at each other...

"Is this medium rare?" I asked. I then looked at the steak and saw it was clearly past medium-rare into medium / medium-well territory. Still good, but clearly not what he asked for. So, after a little hemming and hawing, we settled on returning it. "Don't feel bad. It's not what you ordered. Send it back."

Spousal-Unit took steak up to the counter. He went up to the bearded-hipster-barista, the only person who didn't have a line of people in front of him. 

Bearded-hipster-barista first disputed that the steak was improperly cooked. After losing that round, bearded-hipster-barista claimed spousal-unit ate too much of the steak - that it was "half gone" and he couldn't possibly have it remade. 

(in case you lost count - Spousal-Unit had one bite and I had one bite - "half gone" would mean a steak that lasted four bites, right?)

After several seconds of angry glaring, bearded-hipster-barista finally relents and says they will remake the steak. 

Steak came out ten minutes later. The new one was about 25% bigger and perfectly cooked. 

We were not upset about the original screw up. Anybody can overcook a steak. The steak they gave us was small, and small steaks are *easy* to overcook. We don't blame the cooking staff. 

But what really RUINS A MEAL is getting attitude from waitstaff for making a complaint. It's hard enough to start that conversation. Nobody wants to be that guy who says some variant of "hey, you did this wrong." I think it's worse to say it than to be told it. 

So, already one point down, and then we get some really stinky attitude and it's just impossible to appreciate the rest of our meal. God knows we tried. The food was good. But we just couldn't shake the after effects of what should have been a conversation but was, instead, a confrontation. 

We're both iffy on ever going back.
author: Tim W.

description:
Came back just for the bagels, which are delicious but also HUGEEE. Got two: one with hummus, avocado and veggies and the other with cream cheese, avocado, and veggies. Once again, HUGEEE. All the ingredients they use are fresh, the bagel is slightly toasted/crispy, and it's stacked. And it felt slightly healthy so I didn't feel too bad eating it.

And I've always found their choice of music for a brunch spot confusing -- it's like super intense EDM/trap music which I really like but not usually my first choice at noon on a Sunday.
author: Jingxi Z.

description: The Grind is a great neighborhood spot with a huge menu of delicious comfort foods. For breakfast: the breakfast burrito is amazing and the french toast is just the way mom/dad made it. For lunch or dinner: the chicken sandwiches are huge and tasty (avo/bacon/cheddar my personal fave). The pumpkin chocolate bread and other pastries available are also on point. My only issue is the wifi - it's so slow! Please upgrade!
author: Mark M.

description:
Ugh The Grind, how you have disappointed me. They have every food/coffee/cafe option you could possibly want but they seem to have the hardest time delivering it. The smoothies (made without added sugar) are fresh and delicious. The eggs, salads, sandwiches etc. are all fresh and neatly built. A nice neighborhood spot, The Grind is reliable for a table and have a nice little outside seating area.

However, on my first visit. Our number was attached to the wrong order and the server insisted he was right when the food we order was completely different from what was brought out. Turned out our order was switched with a take out order.

Second time, they lost our order completely. When they did finally remake it and bring it out the sides and how the eggs were cooked etc was all wrong. The waitress did bring us two free coffees but I was still disappointed.

In summary, if your food seems to be taking longer than usual, check in with the server because it's probably lost or forgotten.
author: Caroline A.

description: I would give this place a five star rating had it not been for the fact that this past Sunday the employee arrived an hour late. No employee accountability.  Otherwise the food was pretty solid.  I went for breakfast everyday that I was in SF so I am not dismissing the quality of the food just the service in some way.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Great casual place for lunch.  We had the grilled chicken sandwich and a glass of red wine.  We would definitely go back.  Food was excellent, service is not great, because we asked for a share plate and It never showed up, but the food made up for It.
author: Eric E.

description:
I call in to order to go, and the guy that answers is very unfriendly, and gives a attitude! I have been going to The Grind over 20x but now that the new guy is working; I hardly go. 
I do love the vegan scramble, which he messed up! I got a veggie scramble instead with CHEESE :( I am very unhappy with his overall customer service :T
author: Janet C.

description: Excellent food for the price. Great relaxing environment as well. Cool music too. Some of my favs in the modern chill indie rock genre played.
author: Malik M.

description: The food seems ok but the service is extremely bad. Except for the cashier, everyone else is very rude. I couldn't find the Department of Health rating which worries me because they tried to clean a cup with their rug that they used to clean their table. I wouldn't go back and wouldn't recommend it.
author: Anne B.

description:
Food is pretty good for generic diner type food, but overpriced. That aside, this review is more about the service. I'm flatout done with this place. The people taking your order and making the drinks are not friendly, do not say hello  when you get to the counter, do not smile, do not say thank you for tips or even acknowledge them and can't be bothered to even say you're welcome. And this is not me being sensitive - read the other negative reviews. The Grind just lost a $30-$40 a week customer because their counter employees lack common decency. Maybe it's a reflection of the owner/manager. I've seen the guy in there and he's not friendly either. It's a bummer because even though the prices are kind of absurd for what you get, the food is solid and it's convenient for me to eat there. Oh well, I go elsewhere

(please note that this review does not apply to the kitchen staff. those guys actually smile and acknowledge the customer when they bring out the food - one star for them, one star for the food).
author: Jeff M.

description: Defiantly coming back! Great Food and great Menu selection visiting here in SF town definitely would say to work on getting the kids orders out of the way .. I ordered pancakes for my daughter and got her pancakes last:/ everyone else was done by the time I got her order. Kid friendly environment.
author: Yessica M.

description:
I just stopped here for a quick bite of a pastry and some iced tea. The ginger peach iced tea was especially refreshing, and I had free refills too. I had a good couple of pastries: a raspberry bar and a lemon cake. I can't vouch for any of their other food, but what I tried was pretty good. 

I also like the vibe of the place. It was very open, with lots of light, and it had almost a cafeteria feel. There were several people there working on their laptops or having coffee in the mid-afternoon.
author: Molly M.

description:
My new favorite spot for lunch! They have a little bit of everything for everyone. I've been here now a handful of times. You have the option to sit inside or outside patio which is great. Service is awesome always quick. 


Cobb salad- generous portion and taste amazing! (However ask for the dressing on the side)

Chinese chicken salad- two thumbs up! 

Chicken Ceasar- good but a bit over dressed. 

Patty melt- delish 

Garlic fries- they're ok, nothing like the ball park. 

Blueberry crumb cake- fresh and to die for.

Smoothies- Meh, a tab bit over priced. 

Iced coffee and regular coffee- not bad! However if you want whipped cream they do not have the proper lids for them!
author: Rox N.

description: Wow had a BLTA on sourdough yummy! The fries are incredible. Courteous staff and clean restaurant.
author: Jill L.

description: I'm giving 3 stars because I love the food here. Always a delicious meal. In addition to that I'm not deducting stars on poor customer service. As a matter of fact the staff are very very friendly. My less than perfect score for The Grind is directed towards the kitchen. Although the food is tasty, and the price reasonable, 2 out of the last 3 times I've been there they have either lost/forgotten my order or it took a painstakingly long time for it to arrive, thus making me late either getting back to work or just straight up pissing me off. You got a good thing "The Grind", tighten it up. Oh yeah, and stop being so stingy on the fries. Toss me more than 4 fries with my $12 burger. Thanks.
author: Luke P.

description:
I stop in here regularly after morning rides up Hawk Hill. There's usually only a few people in the cafe around 7:30 am on weekdays, so we bring our bicycles up on the front porch area outside instead of locking them up.

Last time I was here, I got the Sicilian omelette (pesto, sundries tomatoes, fresh tomatoes, and feta cheese) with a side of hash browns and sourdough.

The coffee is decent and served in either a mug or a pint glass (kind of novel).
author: Andrew C.

description: Very close to our home. Breakfast was delicious and portion was huge. We've enjoyed the banana&walnut pancakes
author: Pinar D.

description:
Good place for a hearty breakfast and a good cup of coffee. Had the Grind Scramble with hash browns and sourdough toast...really good! Looks like it gets crowded fast and seating can be a little tough to find when it does.

Has a good vibe, staff is cool. Also, in case it matters to you, the restroom is pretty clean!

I'll definitely be back to try something else on the menu.
author: Ed N.

description: My boyfriend ordered the hot link scramble and asked to substituted the sausage with tofu. The guy at the front "Mac Sabbath" was rude from the start. I also asked for my eggs to be over medium and not runny so he told me I should order them hard which is not what I wanted. We ordered our food and my eggs were completely hard. My boyfriends order not only had meat in it which he specifically said to substitute for the tofu and had no eggs which is not a scramble. When he took the order to the guy at the front to explain that it was wrong "mac sabbath" took no responsibility for putting the order in wrong and asked for my boyfriend to save his potatoes so that they didn't have the remake them. They ended up bringing the order back wrong again with no eggs. Bad service!
author: Lisa G.

description:
Girl at the register was very unpleasant. No greeting, no smile. We even said hello and she just gave us a face with a little attitude. 
Food was great!! Big portions, so keep that in mind. 
The mango smoothie was the bomb! 
Nice little location.
author: Maria R.

description:
I came here for brunch Sunday morning before heading back to LA. 

I had the Hummus, Avocado, Tomato, Sprouts & Red Onion bagel and it was ok. It kind of lacked flavor. Service was also kind of slow. The place was busy though. 

Ambiance is OK and I was able to accommodate seating for a larger group of people.
author: Cindy B.

description:
Delicious, worth the price!

House blend Coffee was so good and the price was very reasonable.

Had Acropolis omelette with home fries and sourdough. Highly recommended for any vegetarian. 

Hubby had breakfast sandwich with bacon and eggs and French fries and said it was delicious.

Our friend had steak and eggs and was also delicious according to him.

Will be coming back for sure!!!
author: JC M.

description: Popped is to this great all-day-cafe for much need breakfast. Saw they had Belgian waffle... with fresh fruit, I was a little hesitant because how difficult it can be to cook all the way through. But my gamble definitely worked out, had to get the fresh fruit. All was tasty the coffee was good, the strawberries, blueberries and sliced banana tasted fantastic. Was really a nice touch. The flavors were all there, nothing popped out uniquely. The house coffee was quite good as well, didn't catch what they brewed with.
author: Ari T.

description: This was an ok spot. I felt it was overpriced for the quality of the food, but it wasn't horrible. I got the Scott Street omelette. It was a good size and it tasted good. It's counter service which I wasn't a fan of and they charge if you want any dressings.
author: Tania C.

description:
Waited in a long line and then waited 20 more minutes for a soggy breakfast burrito. I didn't hate it, but I didn't love the pool it left on my plate or having to finish it with a knife and fork.

Though the menu was huge, nothing really stood out to me. Maybe I'll try an omelette next time. 

The outdoor-indoor patio area is super nice!
author: Sara M.

description: The French toast was gross and tasted like orange and the chicken fried steak was soggy and and tasted gross
author: Irene K.

description:
Pretty great assortment of breakfast and lunch foods. The service people are nice enough, but don't seem to take a passionate ownership for their work or their jobs.  But they are competent and nice enough.
The food prices are moderate, and the quality is good, but watch out for the bill adding up for any modifications or additions you add to the meals. Is all fair and reasonable, but it adds up unexpectantly.
author: Gregg A. J.

description: I love the grind so much. It's my neighborhood fave in Lower Haight. Great / good coffee, like actual Lattes, etc. (very hard to find around here, I've tried almost everywhere). Mimosas and beer when you want it. Consistently awesome omlettes, my personal fave - scrambles, and a filling breakfast burrito with avocado and salsa. All this plus a covered patio and free wifi - Yes please!
author: L A.

description: Coffee is pretty good, service is usually good- just don't interrupt people serving. Had one issue one time where my order wasn't right, my omelette was missing bacon that I paid for and they asked the kitchen and the kitchen said they put it in there so they ignored me.
author: Taylor A.

description:
Really solid breakfast/lunch spot. 

Lots of really good options. My go to is the breakfast burrito with bacon. Ask for your hashbrowns inside the burrito. This is a game changer. 

I also recommend the following 
- Nutella Waffles
- The Grind Scrambler 

Sometimes the food can take a while to make but it's definitely worth it. This place can also get really busy around brunch time on weekends so go early or later to avoid the crowds
author: Harsan S.

description:
Just came back from lunch, or should I say brunch? Came up on the french toast topped off with blueberries and the hash browns didn't suck either!

Other things that were neat: tall ceilings, skylights, outdoor seating, outlets along the wall, and I hear they make coffee too. I'll have to try the brew next time I'm out this way.
author: Paolo V.

description:
3 stars for the customer service.

I wanted to really give this place 5 stars but after taking my parents on a Saturday morning, I was upset at the chubby white gentlemen who took our order. My mother had a question about a pastry and when he took notice of the line, he grew rather instantaneously annoyed and more or less bothered by the fact that she had questions about their pastries, rather than performing the job he is paid to do which is provide top of the line customer service to guests who come and spend their money because we definitely are not here because we heard food was free..... I don't understand why businesses who are successful because of their fresh and delicious food tend to hire individuals not cut out to deal with a large group of people on a busy day. I mean what do you expect when a place has great food to offer, but I guess when you get people who lack a simple skill such as common courtesy or respect, there isn't much turning back from that.

The Grind Cafe does have really good food, but man, a change in staff must occur soon, except their is this really nice girl who is patient, friendly, and always smiling !
author: Marlon M.

description: The girl with pink hair that makes the coffee is a horrible human being!!! Worst service I've ever had!!! She shouldn't be working in a public place!!! Wouldn't recommend that place. The food was not flavorful
author: Danai P.

description: Myriad of foodstuff for a great weekend brunch and GET their hot chocolate with whipped cream.
author: Sofia C.

description: Perfect little cafe spot for brunch or lunch. Reasonable prices for the quality and amount of food. Super yummy. Also very friendly staff.
author: Liz W.

description:
My order took 40 minutes (40!) to come (20 minutes after I first asked, plus 20 for the actual food). I understand that a mistake can happen, but the fact that no one even apologized grinds my nerves.

On the food: I ordered Benedict eggs, my partner an Scott St omelette. The eggs were dry (ala Mc Donalds breakfast) and the hash browns lacked any salt (might or might not be a bonus for you). The omelette was good, though. The orange juice didn't taste fresh.

Giving it 2 stars instead of 1 just for the fact that the food actually came, and it looked like no one spitted on it, which is nice.
author: Dario R.

description: Ordered two sandwiches to go at 2pm. Got them 50 minutes later. No warning. Sandwiches are not bad but the service here is bad.
author: David L.

description: Such a delicious little place. The menu was tempting on so many things... Finally broke down and had the biscuits and gravy with sausage. Drooling still thinking about it. It was amazing. Must go back and get more, and get that same waitress because she was so cool.
author: Meredith B.

description:
Not sure how I haven't reviewed the Grind before, seeing as how I grew up quite literally ACROSS THE STREET, but it's not like reviewing restaurants was the cool thing to do in middle school, so here we go. Better late than never.

I'll always been happy eating at The Grind if its convenient, because the menu is big, the food is solid, and you'll rarely, if ever, leave disappointed. But even after all these years, its still far from being one of my "favorite places". 

I went with the Grind Combo (Pancakes, hashbrowns, scrambled eggs, bacon). It was definitely satisfying, as you get your money's worth, but it was far from life-changing. 

Hashbrowns are dope. Crunchy, crispy, tasty and delicious. 

Pancakes are good, although they're a little heavy (as opposed to being light & fluffy), especially once you throw syrup on them. 

In short breakfast was as breakfast always is here, good, but not the best. Definitely think you can do better with Kate Kitchen or Eddie's Cafe, nearby options which are both slightly better. If I could give 3.5 stars I would in a heartbeat, but as it is 3 stars will have to do.
author: Brian S.

description:
I had been wanting to come here for a while - bad choice - not a welcoming experience. From the moment I ordered my food, the person receiving my order couldn't understand what "2 eggs, bacon, hasbrowns and toast" meant. I had to repeat myself several times. When my mom and I sat down, we noticed the table wasn't cleaned properly. I politely asked the server if he could please clean the table - to which he gave me a look like I was wasting his time. He never cleaned it but brought our food and placed it on top of the food left behind by the previous folks. When we went to talk to another staff member about this, she stated "Well, he's stressed." No apologies and still, no one to come over and clean so we moved tables. He didn't look too stressed when he was laughing with the other servers. Work is stressful - I get it, but cleanliness and customer service is a big part of being successful in the restaurant business. Plus the food was sub-par. 

You won't be getting my business. Too many other cafes with better quality and customer service.
author: MARIA M.

description:
Cashier is an asshole. 
Super rude, not polite. Doesn't smile, makes me feel unwelcomed.
author: Magaly J.

description: Came here because basically everything was off the menu at the Black Sands Brewery (bad planning - it was only 12.40pm on a Sun). This review is pretty mixed. My partner had some blueberry pancakes which were good, but I ordered a bowl of the chili of the day (beef) which was barely luke warm (I hate cold food) & a strawberry & banana smoothie which was "meh". I really wanted to like this place as it has a really extensive & tasty sounding menu, but it's unlikely we'll be back. It's not hard to heat up chili.
author: Fi M.

description: I personally enjoyed the food. This is the 3rd time I've been here. The pesto chicken was very good, awesome burgers. If you have a stick up your culo like the idiots below me that think there food critic's than this is not your place. But for me. I like a bargain and very nice people. The menu is easy and serve your own water and coffee. Over all I will keep coming back. I'm glad these so called food critics stop coming so I can enjoy my new San Francisco to go spots.
author: Craig L.

description:
I had a late morning flight out and wanted to grab a bite before heading off to SFO.  This place was blocks from my hotel and I went there super early.

I ordered a half stack of the banana coconut macadamia nut pancakes, which when you think about it, is just one less pancake (two giant sized plates instead of three).  I still wasn't able to finish it.  It was delicious and moist, and the fruit and nut combination was so good.

I thought service was good, but it was empty when I was here, with people coming and going for their morning cup of coffee before their morning commute.
author: Alex K.

description:
Meh. 

Portions are big. Food is just ok. Coffee is very metallic tasting.

I had the patty melt. They asked me how I wanted it cooked - I said medium-rare. It came out well-done. And I'm pretty sure no matter what I would have said it would have come out that way. So, I don't know why they ask. I got the cesaer salad...again, not great. A bit bland.

Four of us ordered together. I got my food first, waited so long that I started eating. And had ate nearly my entire meal before my friends got their eggs and hashbrowns. I'm not a fan of restaurants that serve one meal before the others.

My friends' meals looked ok and they enjoyed them. I probably won't visit this place again and would say that the street has much better options to choose from.
author: Sarah S.

description:
A great breakfast / lunch staple for the neighborhood. Good service, quality food.

Favorites:
Breakfast Burrito
Turkey Bacon Croissant Sandwich
Cobb Salad
Curly Fries

The only thing I have had that I'm not a fan of is the regular french fries (just not crispy enough for me).
author: Stephanie C.

description:
So solid!

My go-tos are the salads, the hot pastrami sandwich, and random breakfasty items like scrambles, breakfast burritos, omelettes, and the like... but everything I've seen has been above average and the menu is vast.

Prices are reasonable, people are generally pretty nice, good space/outdoor seating, good wifi, and CURLY FRIES too... it can be hella packed on weekend mornings though, and I think it must be in a guide book of some sort, because there's often foreign tourists slowing down the line.
author: Jake D.

description:
I LOVE The Grind. I like the vibe you get when you walk in--casual and comfortable. It can get pretty crowded in here and as a result you might have to sit pretty close to strangers...like touching elbows close...but that's just a quirk of the Grind's! It's a place where you go up to the counter to order and then they bring your food over to the table. 

I ordered the #8 bagel and it was delicious! I've been here a total of two times and the first time I had no problem getting the bagel of my choice, but the second time they ran out of garlic and onion so I had to settle on wheat--don't get me wrong it was still delicious! 

This is a great place if you want a cheap and fun place eat!! I would recommend for breakfast, lunch or brunch. Bagels range from around $4-$9 dollars depending on the bagel you choose (for example mine was around $5 but I was with someone who got the lox bagel and that one was around $9). If you're in the area definitely check it out!
author: Julia O.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for our last food stop before we headed back home and I was so upset with the quality of what we got. Bar far the worst breakfast burrito I ever had, and the worst coffee. I always order the same coffee everywhere I go-- Soy Vanilla Latte with an added shot of expresso. When I got my coffee I nearly spit it out. It was so gross, sour, yet bitter. And it nearly costed me ten dollars. I wasn't about to throw my money down the drain so I went up hoping that they would trade it in for a different one. With some eye movements from the barista, they changed it out for one with less expresso. (Hence that is why I gave them a two star and not a one) But when I got the second coffee it nearly tasted the exact same! Their coffee is just horrible and tastes burnt. So-- I then took the loss and didn't drink it. When my
Breakfast burrito came I was quickly disappointed. Although everything that was in it was explained on the menu, no where did it state that is an extremely spicy burrito. "Salsa" does not mean spicy. This burrito was just almost intolerable. Then it just got worse the more I ate it. The cheese in it tastes like the cheese you would spray out of a can. The sour creme was hot and runny. The eggs had no salt and tasted like the kind you would get in a subway breakfast sandwich. Everything in this burrito was god awful. How do you mess up an egg burrito? Even the sausage was gross and too big for the burrito. I had to pick them out. And I'm not even a picky eater. This place made me feel like I was when in reality everything was just so gross. I wasted 20 dollars on a disgusting coffee and a god awful burrito. I honestly don't know how this place has any business.
author: Emily S.

description: Love this place! I've had the breakfast burrito, bagel with cucumber and Nutella latte and they were all delicious- the latte was heavenly. Service is quick and the portions are big! The burrito could easily be 2 meals.
author: Michelle S.

description:
My favorite meal is breakfast/brunch and this was an awesome place to have it! I ordered the Acropolis omelet and it was amazing! It came with a large portion of PERFECT hash browns. My son had the kids pancakes and they added strawberries upon request, he also had a side of bacon (he ate every last bite-and so did I!). The restaurant has a great atmosphere, we made conversation with the table next to us throughout the meal and throughly enjoyed the atmosphere. The prices were FANTASTIC for SF and just in general. Highly recommend!

The only drawback that I could see is that there was no table service or waiters so I had to get up a couple of times to get a couple of items (not a big deal and this is probably what keeps the prices so low). 

A+
author: A M.

description:
I go to this place because is near my work and I honestly the food is great tasty, and always fresh. However the staff the counter need an attitude adjustment. A few years back while I was trying to get my coworker order over the phone a girl taking my order told me that i couldnt be in the phone if i was going to order. and not to long ago a couple of the new staff are just completely rude, they spend more time talking to each other instead of taking my order. They really need to work in their customer service.

the food get 5 stars 
the staff get 0 stars
author: Nia L.

description: Was able to order right away, breakfast burrito came fast and hot. Was not expecting the breakfast burrito to be as big as it was. I was recommended to add hash browns inside of the burrito and it was awesome. I told myself only to eat half.....that didn't happen. I recommend this place and have to say it's one of my top places for breakfast.
author: Sean B.

description: Nice space but it is very noisy for working or meeting people. It is mostly best for taking out food real quick, but the food is mediocre too... It would be nice if they stepped up the food a bit to feel fresher.
author: K P.

description: This place used to serve food that was worth the price but the quality has declined significantly in the last few months. The coffee is decent, as is the croissant french toast, but their scrambles are greasy and their regular french toast is bland and soggy. Eat here if you're starving and need a quick fix but if you want a good breakfast/brunch you're better off finding another spot in the city. Maven, Kate's Kitchen, and NOPA are all within walking distance and offer far superior brunches.
author: Chriselle B.

description:
I really enjoy the food here, and have never had one thing I didn't like.

The  breakfast burrito with the hash browns inside vs. on the side is perfection. The sandwiches are fresh and filling: club sandwich, tuna melt, and burger, all yummy! Have them with the curly fries if you're into that sort of thing. My friend favors the garlic fries. And I am ordinarily not a salad-person, but the Oriental chicken salad or the beet salad with a soup on the side makes for a filling (but light) lunch.

I would go more often, but the service is consistently very slow. I understand the restaurant does not have waiter service, so by slow I mean the lines always seem to be long, and it takes a longer time for food to come out than most places I am used to. This is especially true during weekends and lunch time, obviously (I have never been here in the morning).

I get it; they are always super busy. And there are very few brunch options in the area. Is it worth the wait? The food is really really good, so I would say it's worth it only if you are not prone to getting hangry. The fact that it takes so long is a testament to the freshness of the food, I think.

I get takeout more often than I dine in. They usually quote my pick up time as 20-30 minutes (except for one New Years Day, where takeout order wait time was estimated at over an hour! The busyness they experience is no joke). The service is not super friendly, nor have I ever experienced them being outright rude as other reviews have said. I think they just do their extremely busy job and aren't here to make friends. With the lines they get, I don't blame them.
author: Trish B.

description: I've been here twice, and each time have not been disappointed. I always get the open-face bagel (#11), and a soy latte. And my boyfriend usually gets one of the omelettes and a dirty chai. DELISH. My only complaint is that the bacon isn't that great... but the service and food is pretty good! Definitely will be back.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Had breakfast here the other day. My breakfast burrito was so juicy and delicious. The avocado inside my burrito was also fresh (huge deal for me)! Definitely coming back here!!
author: Flo H.

description: I've been here a few times and they have an extensive menu, but brunch is my favorite. However, they do not close at 9 as Yelp says, but at 8 during the week. Went there around 7:30 on a Monday and they had already stopped making espresso drinks and smoothies.
author: R D.

description:
Two new San Franciscan ( French  people ) 
It was our first breakfast in the city ! We liked the food, the place ! It's a Very good place !!!

My favorites : the chai tea ( the best !), the bagel with sprout and all of the burgers ;)
author: Laura B.

description:
I don't get it. Its so hip it hurts. 

Its trying so hard to be cool its uncool. The food is basic and nothing special but its expensive. They take forever to brew a latte and then don't bring it to you, so if you sit outside you have to keep an eye on it. 

Two people to have a light breakfast cost 40 bucks and the service was average. The only time the two people who seemed to be in charge seemed happy is when they played a song on which was clearly for their benefit. 

The dynamic seems to be front of the house cool kids and Mexican bus boys/chefs. 

If you have a lot of money and want to eat somewhere simply because its trendy then go for it. If you want some decent service or some good food then keep moving. 

I also met the shaved and tattooed head girl, she's not the biggest sunshine, I think she's waiting for the bus to take her to something better in life.
author: Rusty S.

description: the food is good! the staff behind the counter is just rude each and every time I go.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
This place is conveniently located on the wiggle bike route. I've always ridden by and been curious. My friend and I tried it out after working up an appetite at the gym. 

It reminds me of a crepevine in a way with the pay first setup and big menus on the wall. 

I had a delicious mocha and the grind scramble. The food tasted great and didn't take that long. 

I think if they open up an additional register when the line is long they would surely deserve that 5th star that they should get. I'm definitely going to bring people here.
author: Marty J.

description: Meh. Don't come here if you are looking for coffee or pastries that are better than Starbucks/Peets. Small mom & pop coffee shops are always a gamble b/c anyone can get into this business and coffee lovers/needers will buy from them, and this is not impressive. Pastries look old and dry, and the waffles are relatively expensive pre-made cake things... Coffee is better than some places, but still meh. I wouldn't stop here again.
author: Sadie G.

description: I was a regular here for many years but lately they've forgotten my order on several occasions and treat me like I'm not there so I gave up.
author: Klik W.

description:
Solid.
This is a place to to when no one in your group can figure out what the hell they want. It will appease all pallets, you pay separately at the register, food comes swiftly to you.
author: Ryley P.

description: Out of town looking for low-stress coffee and brunch. French toast was tasty - with a hint of orange. Good, basic breakfast fare. Comfortable and unpretentious.
author: Tracy S.

description:
My coworkers wanted to eat bbq for lunch a couple blocks away but I didn't want such a heavy lunch and found this place on yelp.

I ordered the veggie omelet with eggwhites and fruit. The omelet was pretty good. Filled with different veggies and cheese. The fruit bowl it came with was impressive: strawberries, blueberries, cantaloupe and pineapple. It came with toast and I asked for a side of PB which they charged me 50 cents for. 

The restaurant itself was big and spacious. I'd come back and try other items on their menu.
author: Bobbie W.

description:
Overall I wasn't too impressed with my visit. I ordered chicken fingers and fries. The man behind the counter tried to charge me $12 when it was only $8. I told him about the price discrepancy and when I pointed to the board to show him he said, "You're probably right." I wanted to say, "I know I'm right, it's right up there on the board!" but my inner Britney told me I better not. 

Maybe I should order something more "real" and requires a bit more 'finesse' but I don't know if I'd come back. Tables were clean.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Mid Saturday afternoon and I needed a place to sit and recharge after walking the Haight.  

We saw the Grind and decided this would be it. It had a lovely little patio, it looked clean and when I walked inside, the food on display looked great and the coffee smelled fantastic.  I placed an order for a spinach salad & a bowl of chili. Both were served rather quickly, and while the salad was excellent, the chili was quite mediocre.
author: Dianna B.

description: Love the vegan options. I also appreciate it's a pretty roomy location so you're not always bumping into someone. I only got one thing but everyone else I was with liked this place a lot.
author: Stuart F.

description:
This place is great, very reasonable prices and great food.... forgot how great sf is

Busy on weekends the line moves fast, the food not so much, but it is worth the wait
author: Alan R.

description:
HOSPITALITY AND FOOD VERY POOR
(----)
We came here after the review! What disappointment! The service was bad! No smile! It seems to bother them! The atmosphere is very cold! When the meal arrived still a disappointment, no presentation and the food had no taste, I can do better myself! 
I drink all the time a chai latte, this is the first Time I couldn't finish! It was bad! 
Place is to avoid !
author: Marie P.

description:
How I haven't written a review yet is beyond me.  The Grind has been my reliable, go-to spot for the last 5 years since moving to SF (it certainly helps practically living upstairs).  When I was working, I'd stop in more frequently for coffee on my way out. It's usually the first meal I eat after returning from any vacation and not having food in the fridge.  I even find myself coming here after I've gone grocery shopping and unpacked the massive load of food (in efforts to reduce my eating out habits) and not having the energy to cook. 

Faves on the menu --  all breakfast items (though I usually end up with a scram), the pear salad with tuna, the eggplant sandwich, the Reuben. One roommate loves the bfast burritos. 

Lines can get a bit long on the weekends, but if you order to go or just want a quick coffee/drink, they now have a 2nd register closer to the kitchen where you can bypass the line.
author: Shahrzad K.

description: Chill atmosphere and nice location in the heart of SF! The food tasted homemade. I ordered the Mediterranean scram which consisted of scrambled eggs mixed with spinach, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and feta cheese. My girlfriend ordered Nutella pancakes with bananas and that tastes exactly how good it sounds! You won't get disappointed.
author: Melissa C.

description: I came here on vacation. I love breakfast so much and I was so excited to come here with my boyfriend. I have a bad gluten allergy and they were listed on Yelp as a "gluten free" option. I asked the cashier what options I had. She was not helpful at all. I asked a few questions more and her response got worse and worse. It was $16 for 4 ounces of eggs and fruit.... Completely over priced. The only thing that was good, was the cappuccino. My boyfriend had to wait for his food forever. I was already finished with my meal. I worked in restaurants for many years and this is not how you give great customer service. The owner should really look into training his employees.
author: Brooke S.

description:
While in SF, I stayed right around the corner from this little café. Due to its convenient location, I visited a handful of times. The coffee is fantastic, and the caramel latte deserves 5 stars. Unfortunately, I had two bad experiences with the service here so I have to say it's a 3 star spot. 

5 star visit my first time when I had a caramel latte and the Haight scramble with bacon, avocado, and green onions; both were delicious. 

1 star visit the next time I came when I ordered an egg and cheese sandwich on an English muffin, was given an egg and cheese sandwich on a croissant, and the staff would not revise my order for some reason when I asked. I ended up scraping off the egg and cheese because I hate croissants and confrontation. 

2 stars on the third visit because I ordered a bagel with cream cheese to go and ended up waiting 15 minutes for it.
author: Meg R.

description: Great food! Offers tofu substitutions for eggs, which surprised me (in the best way). Extremely friendly service, comfy atmosphere. Would totally come back.
author: Sarah R.

description: I really like this place. The price for quality is great, indoor/outdoor seating.  It can get crowded on the weekends, but only at peak hours as expected. They serve breakfast all day, so good. The quality is higher than other dinners too. The menu is what you want when you want comfort food, but it's not a greasy spoon. They serve actual hash browns! Its just a chill local place.
author: Shana A.

description: I wish I could love this place since it is my neighborhood cafe (and I adore my neighborhood) but they are terribly rude, on several occasions. The Baristas for some reason think they are a gift to the world and act accordingly. I am a daily soy/almond milk latte drinker and the final straw came when I ordered my usual large soy latte and was given a regular milk latte. I wanted to make sure it was a soy latte since the super cool barista only said "latte." She said no its a regular latte and that I need to specify next time what it is I want before it is made. Oh really?? (sarcasm) And then she proceeded to charge me an extra 50 cents for a mistake they made, which is fine. I just dont need barista hipster attitude especially since I am a regular. If you love lots of morning tude and snooty high horse service, this is your place!
author: Cai W.

description: My favorite, most consistently reliable place for yummy great lunch/brunch. I used to just order their french dip and chai latte day after day because I loved it so much. I'm always happy with their breakfasts as well (I like places that aren't stingy with their fruit). Not quite a 5-star place though, since their service can be slow from time to time, and a friend I brought here had a sad experience with a cold omelette.
author: Kaitlyn L.

description:
This place is clean and fast and the coffee is decent and comes in nice big cups. Atmosphere is OK, you go up to the register to give your order and then they bring it to your table. 

I ordered Hash Brown Hill from their "House Favorites" and it was a significant disappointment. Instead of a "mound of hash browns" as promised, it was two connected pieces of flat pre-made style hash browns topped with cheese, with a portion of avocado and sour cream. To do the dish right you need to grate your own potatoes or at least buy the frozen shredded potatoes and then cook the hash browns griddle style so they come out loose and crispy, not like a flat, might-have-been-a-potatoe-but-is-now-just-a-sad-example-of-factory-produced-food dish.
author: Peter H.

description:
Service is horrible,  staff is rude.  Waited forever for food, no apology, no nothing. When they finally did bring it, the order came out in very strange sequence-- first out three breakfast sausages, then the French toast, then the eggs.  When we got home fries instead of hash browns,  when up to get it corrected. Again with the home fries.  The guy's response "I asked you if you wanted home fries or hash browns, you said home fries"  
Food is okay, nothing special for San Francisco.  I think Crepevine on Church has much better food, Squat and Gobble about the same. Service at either place is heads above this.  I can't remember when I've seen such bad service and I eat out a lot. 

No brewed decafe, if that's your thing.     Add insult to injury when I asked for a refill after all this they still had the nerve to charge 50 cents

. 
Gets a star cause they do have a nice outdoor area.
author: Dennis N.

description:
This place is along my am commute so I stop in occasionally to treat myself (and if I'm willing to gamble my fate of the quality of my beverage). 

The sweet soy chai is my order and when the male barista makes it it tastes like unicorns dancing on rainbows... Which is delicious.... However when the female barista makes it it has always come out tasting like bitter watered down chai.

I tried giving her the benefit of the doubt but we are at 3 for 3 now and I even try to continue drinking thinking "this will get better." It doesn't, I end up throwing out the 4 dollar drink and not complaining because I just don't think pissing off your barista is a good idea. Anyways I now peer in to see who is slinging drinks before committing.

Good luck, and may the odds be ever in your favor.
author: Janette P.

description:
"Who wants mimooooooooosaaaaaaas?!"

That's how my Sunday morning in San Francisco began.  Who cares that we were hungover from the night before?  Obviously what we needed was some champagne in our veins to brighten our spirits.  Unfortunately, after the aforementioned mimosas were gone, we realized that what we *really* needed was brunch -- and it had better be close, because there was no way that we were going to stumble through San Francisco traffic in our tragic state.

The easiest thing to do was walk down the block to the Grind, which is an absolutely charming cafe where hippies and yuppies alike can nosh on hearty casual fare.

What could be more San Francisco than that?

Anywho, after placing our order at the counter, we sat down on the comfy patio, which is a prime spot for people-watching.  I'm partial to the guy with the face tattoos who had an uncanny resemblance to the dalmatian that he was walking.

Oh right -- the food!  Can't forget about that.  I had a chicken pesto sandwich, which was absolutely superb!  It was so light and flavorful and full of herb-y flavor (and even though it is SF, I'm not talking about *that* kind of herb).  The salad was a perfect side, though I would've opted for the fries if I hadn't felt so guilty about the mimosas.

My brunch companion opted for the veggie scramble, which looked totally magnificent -- and huge!  This was enough food for 2, methinks.  Perhaps the only complaint was a lack of spice on the eggs.  Nothing that a little salt and pepper couldn't fix.

The service here was fabulous too.  Our food was in front of us mere minutes after placing our orders.  Water glasses were topped off all the time.  Love the attention that we received here.

In sum: I heart the Grind, almost as much as I heart getting toasted on mimosas.
author: David G.

description:
got a burger and curly fries, nothing too special but a decent filler, $15 with lemonade, not too expensive but service not all that great either. the bus boy was nice, but thats pretty much where the customer service ended. i ordered a lemonade to go with no ice, lady put ice. i kindly apologized and said i asked for no ice. I guess she was mad because she had to fill a new cup, but she was no longer smiley. 
classic "cool" hipster vibe here, not a huge fan. dont plan on going back.
author: muftia k.

description:
Post Memorial Day hangover attendance with a friend. Couldn't decide on sweet or savory so I got both.

Hashbrown Hill + Banana Pancake = about $15 with tip

-I assumed the bananas were cooked into the pancake but they came on top. I got over it but then they ended up being very green bananas. Not a fan of feeling as if I haven't brushed my teeth in 3 days haha. I'll order it properly next time.
author: Zoe M.

description: Here for son's surgery, quaint cafe in a cute neighborhood. Staff is friendly and a steady line of local clientele.
author: Rickie B.

description:
Fresh ingredients and tasty food
I've tried a numerous amount of items on the menu and each time I'm always pleased with the service and the food. Friendly staff and they are pretty quick with our to go orders.
author: C. M.

description: A little small cafe get way it the city. Awesome selection of food and beverages... plus breakfast all day. Very reasonably priced and good portions. This is a perfect place to go just to take a break.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
The Grind Cafe looked inviting. People eating in the patio area, and a decent waiting line for food. We thought the popularity of this place was an attestant to the quality of food, but we were wrong. 

After a long wait and an order, we got our coffees and found an empty table. We waited... and waited... and waited, until we finally got our food. By then, our normal ceramic cups of coffee were almost gone. Free refills? Nope. $.50 cent refills. What breakfast spots charges $.50 cent refills on coffee? Apparently this one. 

The food presentation is as bland as it gets. Rectangle omelette, rectangle serving of hash browns, english muffin. No sprig of parsley or anything to visually enhance the plate. Pancakes, fried eggs, home fries, and again, no thought to presentation.

Ok, now to the food, because hey, it's brunch, and we are too tired to really care much about the wait and presentation. Omelette was ok, nothing spectacular. Had avocado and bacon, and a hint of cheese. Overpowered by avocado, but if you love avocado, then you'll like this omelette. English muffin was barely toasted. More like warmed up. Hash browns were standard greasy fare. 

Eggs were ordered over-medium, but came out soft. Fine. Ham was actually good, so no complaints there. Home fries were hard and bland. Pancakes were the worst pancakes I've ever had at a restaurant. Do NOT order the pancakes. They are like rubber frisbees, but probably taste worse than an actual frisbee. Bland, rubbery, generic bulk instant pancake crap. 

I contemplated paying $.50 cents for a coffee refill, but couldn't bring myself to give them any more of my money.
author: Matt S.

description: Don't order delivery from The Grind. They never get the order right. And half the time, items are missing. So annoying. I'm sorry, but they shouldn't offer delivery service if they can't be bothered to ensure that they are sending out the right orders.
author: Maggie D.

description:
1 the cafe, in the best of times, is a sub-par excuse for a coffee shop. overpriced pastries, overpriced and not terribly good coffee, loud and boorish clientele. kind of a yuppie slaughterhouse

2 their oven vent, which should be taller than the roof of the adjacent building, is instead a good 10 feet shorter, and regularly dumps grease-fryer smoke into our apartment at all hours of the day. when asked if there were any plans to change this to comply with city regulations, we were told "not until someone forces us to"

3 to compound matters, and to really turn things up a notch, for the past week, they've been setting their roof on fire in order to "refinish" it, which has filled our place with thick, black, acrid smoke, making it almost impossible to breathe, and has set our smoke alarm off every ten minutes for the past three days. the police refuse to come investigate, and the dept of public works office i was referred to has never answered the phone once, so instead i'm leaving this yelp review to let everyone know that The Grind is staffed and owned by the worst kind of bourgeois idiots, totally oblivious to the waste and damage they're doing to their neighbors, and to their neighborhood.
BOYCOTT THESE YUPPIE PIGS
author: Mill L.

description: Thank you for having tofu as a substitute on your menu. Everything else is mediocre, but we'll take what we can get.
author: Stumbalina b.

description: I'm shocked at how rude the counter staff is. If I were the owner I would be truly embarrassed that I was paying them to be the face f the business, yet customers were leaving with such a bad experience. Coffee shops are a dime a dozen and your staff is going to put you out of business.
author: Lisa M.

description: I come to this place every often they have great omelettes and nice outdoors eating on hot days. They have fair to good customer service. I love this place for breakfast/ brunch
author: Angie A.

description: A little packed when I went but we got our food fast and it was really good!
author: Josh B.

description:
While on the expensive side for a coffee house, the portions were pretty big IMO

I ordered a bacon and cheese croissant, it was greasy but delicious. The Mrs ordered an omelet complete with the fixins, including potato. She enjoyed it, and got two meals out of it. We both got chai lattes which were delicious. (Why can't new york have chai lattes available en masse like SF does?)

Anyways, this place was good. I recommend it as one of the better coffee shops in SF in which there are a plethora to choose from.
author: renje g.

description:
A nice place to meet friends for brunch. The staff has gotten friendlier since the last time I was there even though the crowd has gotten yuppier. Got the scramble with avocados, bacon and cheddar which was good, had a decent amount of avocado pieces but a little too much cheddar cheese (yes I'm getting ready for summer). They have odwalla orange juice which I like after the fresh juice from the Grove. 
Sitting out on the patio on a nice day, like yesterday, and people watch is the best part. 
Overall not a bad place, a good back up plan.
author: Harshal V.

description: If it tastes too good to be veggie sausage it most definitely is.....Came in this AM for a veggie sausage breakfast burrito. When it arrived I took a bite and it tasted too good to be veggie sausage...checked, and it was bacon. Sent it back and they apologized. Sat back down and a bit later they brought me another breakfast burrito...I took a bite and low and behold it as well tasted a lot like bacon...brought it up to the counter where the lady working responded "shit" and then grabbed what was most definitely a veggie sausage breakfast burrito. I am pleased to inform you that the third burrito did indeed contain veggie sausage. Both employees were very apologetic which I appreciated, and I think there was some confusion over to go vs for here. However, after paying $14 for a veggie burrito that took 3 times to perfect, I would have hoped they'd just refund it at that point. Not to mention I haven't consumed meat in 15 years so praying I don't get sick! Oh well.
author: Charlotte K.

description:
The good:

-Remodeled
-Nice menu selection
-Pretty decent food
-Quick coffee service

The bad:

-It took literally 55 minutes to get two breakfast burritos; most other customers were waiting equally as long for their food.
-One bus person/food runner for the whole restaurant - I felt sorry for that guy.
-Because of the long wait and slow table turn-over, finding an open seat can be difficult in the morning on a weekend


Had the wait not been so long, I would have considered coming back. There was no acknowledgement of how long it took to get food. There are plenty of breakfast/brunch options; one of the main goals of a customer service oriented industry is to make your customers happy! Offer a pastry or a beverage or at least an apology if there's going to be nearly an hour wait after ordering!

In retrospect, I should have asked for a refund and won't plan on coming back in the future.
author: Ryan C.

description: This is my go-to spot when I'm craving sweets like french toast or pancakes. They're usually spot-on, but something was off about today's Banana Nutella pancakes. They're priced at around $8.75 with tax for a stack of 3 pancakes with a drizzle of nutella and half a chopped banana. This recipe/presentation should be revised as they were mostly dry and flavorless even with the added toppings. Coffee is also .50 cents per refill now.
author: Jay C.

description: the food was tasty and presentation was nice, however I got food poisoning here. it left me bed ridden with a trash can close by for 3 days.
author: Selena L.

description:
TL:DR; I can roll with it. Plenty of outlets and energy.

This is one of the most energetic coffee houses around. good light, relaxed people. 

DRINKS
I've only had ice tea, and it was delicious and refreshing. I would drink it again!

AMENITIES 
Outlets! Need to work with wi-fi and plugs? this is your place! 

AMBIANCE
If you need to focus, it can be somewhat difficult to work here. I only lasted about an hour. Lots of people, lots of action
author: Shawn S.

description: The food is ok. The waiters are veery nice though!
author: Michèle B.

description:
Cute place, good coffee & lots of inside & outdoor seating.

I spent most of New Years Day (morning) walking around Haight-Ashbury looking for a place to eat breakfast. Some diners I had been interested weren't open. However, this was on my list of places to try out based on Yelp reviews and luckily it was open New Years Day! 

I ordered a coffee with a 3 stack of Blueberry pancakes. The size of the pancakes were huge, but definitely not my favorite. They tasted bland with very few blueberries mixed in.... but I just added some butter & syrup and I was good to go. My friend ordered an omelette that was so tiny for the price we payed for it. But it was a "healthy" option so we gave it that, we needed to add salt to it for more flavor.  The coffee was tasty. 

What I liked most about this place was the outdoor seating (even though it's a little cramped). We sat right at the edge that is right along the sidewalk so it was nice to see people walking their dogs or wearing their sunglasses... still hungover from the previous night, good for people watching. I'm a fan of the neighborhood it was located in so I give it a star for that. I arrived at about 9:30 am and it became busy shortly after our arrival. 

I've only tried this place once, but I would definitely come back. The staff was super friendly and welcoming, food was decent (might have to fix it up a bit) and the prices were reasonable.
author: Juanita D.

description: Food is average for a cafe. Service isn't that good. I have been here twice and didn't have a good experience either time. The workers are very rude. If you have a question they annoyed and not helpful.  Tables are dirty and sticky wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here last week on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

After Easter Sunday mass...I needed a Mimosa. Since we had been slacking on our gameplan of 52 new places in 52 weeks (aka, we'd been to Zazie's at least twice; stop judging, that place is amazing, we can't help it) we walked down Haight Street to The Grind Cafe. Great outdoor seating, order food at the counter and then they bring it to you. And BIG portions. I have no idea what the hubs got, but I had the french toast (which came with potatoes..they know the way to my heart) and it was delish. I felt bad that I couldn't finish it all. 

Not sure I would go out of my way to come here....but if you are in the neighborhood I'd def. stop in!
author: Melissa N.

description: Referred to is from a local friend.  Awesome breakfast+brunch place.  And we got lucky going mid-day on a Friday - no lines.  Service was fast and not too expensive
author: Eric D.

description: The food was just okay although the menu looks great. It has a variety of breakfast and lunch options. Service was not so good. The staff had an attitude when I asked about my to go food which apparently had been ready for a while but no one had let me know.
author: Morgan S.

description: Entirely mediocre food, and overpriced for what you get. Scrambled eggs were soggy and tasted artificial and the inclusion of cheese = sliced cheese melted on top of the scramble. Juice was not fresh. Pastries tasted like Little Debbie. Very disappointed.
author: Gabe P.

description: Efficient. Good service. Oriental chicken salad is excellent. No frills, nothing super fancy. Just good food well executed.
author: Amy M.

description:
Hungry, thirsty, need some oOmpf in your life? Come on in to the Grind and order something to satisfy your tummy.

It's a nice little spot on the Haight, friendly staff, good selection of caffeinated, fruity, and alcoholic beverages, as well as some tasty bites. Grab a seat inside, on the front patio, or take it to go. I just came here with some friends to grab some coffee and gatorade since they had some. We needed a little energy and some thirst quenching while walking all around the city. I would come back here again.
author: Akvile D.

description:
Went with a large group who enjoyed their meals.  My food, on the other hand, was ok.  Ordered a burger with no cheese and got cheese when it came.  The side salad was drenched in balsamic vinegar..... made it very hard to eat.  Try the lavender lemonade drink, it was yummy and the color purple.

The service was eh.  Nothing special.  The girl at the front counter did not look happy to be there or to take our order.  I may go again and give it a second try.
author: Sonia R.

description:
I've been meaning to write this review for awhile now.

Food and Service are great!!

The BEST Pastrami sandwich I have ever had..so good, it's usually the only thing I order!!
author: Mabel A.

description:
Came in while house sitting with the boyfriend before heading out for a drive to Sacramento. He was on another non-caffeine run, so I decided to follow up. I got a hot apple cider, which came in a fancy glass...and a paper cup sleeve with David Tennant on it. SCORE. (Of course, he ended up getting some caffeinated beverage by "accident", I'm sure.)

He picked up Scott Street omelette (his name is Scott, har-har) and a bagel on the side. I was fully expecting to have some of the omelette, but the bagel with sun-dried tomato cream cheese was too tasty to resist. The omelette platter was a lot more food than we were bargaining for, and I was mainly glad that I didn't order a second one. The cider was okay, but man, that bagel and cream cheese...I really, really, really want another one. Soon.

And honestly, with David Tennant staring at me from my cup, it is pretty much impossible for me to associate this place with anything bad. Soon, bagel and David Tennant...I will be back.
author: Robbin A.

description:
This place is a great neighborhood cafe with a deep choice of menu items. Really love it and definitely recommend it.

My only complaint? When I get food to go and you ask if I want a bag, is it so hard to bag the food for me? I honestly hate that you just put a plastic bag on the counter and walk away as if I'm inconveniencing you. This has happened several times from several people, except the owner.
author: Travis L.

description: Each morning we woke up in the Lower Haight with a singular thought.  How fast can we move our legs to carry us down the street to The Grind.  Banana pancakes?  Check.  Breakfast croissant? Check Check.  French Toast?  Check. Check. Check.  Strong, robust coffee?  Check cubed.  So worth it.  Pay no mind to the less the four star naysayers.  Cinco Estrellas, facilemente!
author: Spider W.

description:
Sunday morning destination spot!

Although finding parking in this area on the weekends requires patience, and the long line of hungover people outside waiting to get inside on a sunday morning never fails to be there, it's menu is worth the struggle.

They have many breakfast options (only have been for breakfast): from yummy hash browns, bacon, waffles , French toast and breakfast sandwiches to the healthier choices of fruit bowls to oatmeal. Literally their are so many choices ! 

The portions are actual decent size portions compared to other breakfast places in the area that have you craving another meal an hour later. 

Service : always friendly.
author: Melanie D.

description:
Simple, fast diner style good. They have traditional crispy hash-browns, scrambled Egss are freshly made. Bacon and toast were cooked to perfection. Conveniently down the street from where we were staying.
Friendly Cashier.
author: Khaled B.

description:
I will begin this review by stating that I think the issues some people have with this place could be alleviated if everyone bussed their own table after they finish eating - the bins are over by the cooking area - do the next person after you a favor and clean up after yourself!

The Grind is an excellent breakfast spot in the Haight. Some items are better than others. For example, you get a potato option with a few items, always get the home fries (otherwise you get french fries or unimpressive hash browns). The homefries are real chopped potatoes with some veggies! The omelets and scram dishes are yummy! I love the Haight Scram. The egg sandwich is surprisingly good too (choose the english muffin as your bread and see). If you like a sweet breakfast, treat yourself with the croissant french toast!

Coffee is basic and good - they also have great smoothies. Overall, a nice place. It can get super busy, with a line going out the door. I always have a moment where I freak out and think I won't get a seat by the time I order, but that's yet to happen.
