Sometimes I come alone and bring a book to read while I finish my coffee, great place to do this :)

I think you  may be able to fit up to a group of 6 here, if you squish some tables together - just keep in mind you order at the counter.
author: Eli P.

description:
This is a neat cafe. Good location, good food, and I like the patio.
THEY DON'T HAVE WI-FI ON WEEKENDS. Yelp says they do, which is misleading.
author: Egon S.

description:
Not bad at all.

Apparently back in May 2008 my standards were higher and my articulation skills were lower. Just complaints and no real details given. Also liked to overuse the letter "o".

Six plus years later would like to think would age my standards have only gone higher and my articulation skills have come along as well. Less use of "o".

Returning to the Grind post remodel (https://hoodline.com/2014/02/the-grind-reopens-today) found a few things to love:

- Huge cup of granola with lowfat plain yogurt (thanks for checking!) and generous slices of bananas, strawberries and blueberries. Very reasonable $5.

- Side of eggs (whites no extra charge), toast (two pieces) and veggie sausage for a delicious build your own breakfast sandwich. Great deal for $6.

- Warm, smooth and potent Americano with sugar free vanilla syrup and nonfat milk. One of the best caffeine deals in townf for $2.

Served by a friendly and accomodating staff (those egg whites, that yogurt checking) and enjoyed along with free WiFi near a huge open window with lots of natural light.

Years ago was correct in saying The Grind is not a bad breakfast spot. Like many things age this place has gotten even better along the way.
author: Jason B.

description:
Ordered a bagel. Waited a half hour and still waiting. Told that we have to wait for all the lunch orders to be made first before they can put the bagel in the toaster.

After we got the bagel, it was rock hard. Girlfriend says it's the worst bagel she has had in her life. 

Wish we could go back and get our $2 tip out of the jar.
author: reza n.

description: Man I used to really like this place. But when I went today... I'll never be back. They had a cockroach walking on the counter by the coffee maker where the Batista was making my drink. I was like... OK one cockroach... its sf... I tried to look past it..  but then I started looking around more and I saw hella squished ones on the floor.... ahhh no thanks. Until this place gets clean I won't be back. I don't like my coffee or eggs w a side of roaches.
author: Heather K.

description:
My wife and I went here for lunch and I was torn as to what rating to give them.  Based solely on the food I would only give them a two or three star rating.  I had the BBQ Bacon Burger and it was OK and not very big.  My wife had the Turkey Burger and I would say the same thing.  Neither were very juicy or had great flavor either.  I got mine with the Garlic Fries, while my wife had the Spicy Curly Fries.  I think the Spicy Curly Fries are much better.  The Garlic Fries are small, matchstick fries which aren't bad, just nothing very special.  Because the fries are so small they don't do a very good job or holding the garlic seasoning.

So, why did I give them three stars?  The people who work here are all very nice and it was one of the few places in the area where you can sit outside.  I was great to sit outside on a nice day and eat with our dog.  All the deserts look wonderful too.
author: Scott L.

description: Tasty, quick and affordable little café with outdoor patio seating. Delicious bagels and other baked treats, but also sandwiches, burgers, etc. Loved their sweet chai and lattes. Great Wi-Fi for working an hour on your laptop. We went back several times during our weekend in the neighborhood.
author: Tessa B.

description:
The scrambles and pastries are great, but the pancakes are expensive and leave a lot to be desired.

Overall, I really dig this place, the unpretentious vibe, and the music. Just lay off the pancakes.
author: Michelle G.

description: Awesome salads (love the beet!), burgers, and sandwiches. I misplaced something, and Suheil (the owner or manager I think) went way way above and beyond to help me locate it. Friendly staff too!
author: I R.

description: The place itself seemed very nice and welcoming only to be deceived the service was terrible and the staff a bit rude the runner kept looking at our number and checking for our food but failed to inform us 45 minutes almost an hour that the kitchen didn't even have our tickets needless to say we are visiting and will not be coming here again
author: Rafel R.

description: We came to The Grind after a late night partying after the pride parade and as soon as we saw chicken fried steak for breakfast we were sold. It's a very casual spot where you order at the counter and the food comes to you, but the prices are really good and won't break the bank to start your day. Food and service was excellent. My only two gripes were the coffee was so-so and if you do have a hangover beware of the construction going on out front because the vibrations will kill your buzz. Sit inside if need be.
author: Joshua C.

description: Great brunch place! This place kind of reminded me of Squat and Gobble, where you order from the registers and then they bring out the food to your table. The food was fresh and the bacon was amazing. The line to order gets long and goes out the door when it gets closer to noon on a weekend. They have some tasty looking baked goods for sale a la carte too, I couldn't resist buying a chocolate dipped coconut macaroon.
author: Jing L.

description:
Basic. Lots of choices. NIce atmosphere. good selection of tea. 
Vegan stuff. Just great food. Nice employees. Gotta always mention that cause they work their butts off.
I had oatmeal with honey and blueberries. Hubby had homefries, eggs, toast and bacon. He really enjoyed it.
author: Cindi W.

description: Just recently found this gem within the last month, and I've been here at LEAST twice a week! Food is resonantly priced, well portioned, and very good!! From the Italian Scramble to the Chicken Bacon Ranch sandwich you won't be disappointed. Parking sucks, but c'mon, this IS San Francisco!
author: Justin E.

description:
I came here for brunch with a friend after a lazy early morning. Walking in, we checked out the menu on the board on the wall. I ordered the oatmeal with mixed fruit and my friend ordered the Belgian waffle and bacon. We just got waters from the self-serve dispenser and went outside to the covered patio area to wait for our food. 

The inside has a really laid-back and airy feel about it. For a Wednesday at around 10:30am, this place was pretty busy. There were friends grabbing food with a group, smaller meetings of people, and people doing work on their laptops. I loved the atmosphere of this place because it was busy, but not crowded and loud.

About 5-10 minutes later, a guy brought our food out. My oatmeal was a good-sized helping -- enough to finish, but still satisfying. Slightly disappointed by the amount and selection of fruit (slivers of strawberries lining the edge of the bowl and about half a banana's worth of slices on top of my oatmeal), but it added a good, healthy sweetness to it. Normally, I don't go out to breakfast and order oatmeal (it's cheap and easy to make at home), but I was felt like being healthy that day. My friend's waffle was about average-sized for a Belgian. It came with three slices of thick-cut bacon and a mini-pitcher of syrup. I tried a small bite of the waffle and it was pretty good.

We bussed our own table and were off for the rest of our day. I'd come back here because the prices were reasonable, the staff was friendly, and the food was pretty good (although not amazing). A solid place. If I lived closer, I would probably choose to study here.
author: Leana L.

description: Good. Fast. Cool vibe. Interesting clientele. Ideal for a fast breakfast on the way to work.
author: Olin H.

description:
My friends and I ended up spending quite some time here during our walks of shame in the morning. It seems like almost every morning while we were in SF, we ended up here, hungover, half dead, in makeup from the night before, and in dire need of caffeine and a couple pastries. 

As far as the pastries go, i'd say 4.5 stars. As for the coffee, 3.5 stars. I have very high standards when it comes to coffee though, so 3.5 isn't actually half bad. Their pumpkin chocolate chip loaf was deeeelicious. Almost as good as the one I make. (almost.) And the raspberry crumble bar was pretty damn addicting. 

Service was iffy. One morning we got the nicest girl but the other mornings we got this chick who made it very clear that she was having a bad day...2 days in a row apparently. 

Free Wi-fi and plenty of seating (although it does fill up quick), good pastries and decent coffee. Next on my list is to try their food that is apparently pretty good as well. Next time.
author: Amanda S.

description: I enjoyed this cafe.  If I lived nearby I would visit frequently. Chicken fried steak was good and not overly salty. Coffee is reasonably priced.  Customer service was aces. Good music. A bit hipster but don't let it fool you, food and service sets it far apart from a place like Mel's Diner.
author: Nathan R.

description: This place has gone down the drain!  Today was the 3rd time I've opened up my bagel to discover they left out 1 of the ingredients listed on the menu and/or they skimp on the tomatoes and avocado. Not worth the money! When you bring it back the guy who made yhe bagel gives you a dirty look and starts speaking spanish to his buddies. LAME!
author: Chris P.

description: I love this place and come here every other Saturday but I HATE the girl working behind the counter (the one with a shaved head and glasses) She is so so rude and when she's there she completely ruins it for me, idk why she's so pissed. Besides that, the food is delicious, a wide selection and not expensive. The waiters are super sweet and fast too! I highly recommend this cute place :)
author: Mayse I.

description: The tofu scramble here is pretty much the worst I've ever had but a lot of that was just the poor description. For one, tofu scrambles usually consist of crumbled tofu while this dish at The Grind is strips of fried tofu. Also, the description claimed peanut sauce - instead the sauce was watery and soy-like with absolutely no peanut flavor. I basically love peanut sauce and only ordered this dish for that reason. Massively disappointing. Hash browns and sourdough toast were good but they did not provide enough butter.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Where do I begin...? walking through the neighborhood and found Grind so I checked it out.  Came here for a java pick me up and it must have been the worst I've ever had.

I ordered a vanilla cappuccino, a soy cafe ole and a gluten free chai cookie. My hubby and I agreed that it was just down right bitter and gross tasting and the customer service wasn't even noticeable. 

Overall Grind is not a place I would come to again because the coffee tasted horrible and the lack of enthusiasm is not something I see myself entertaining. It's a place that falls way below average on my list and I can't give them any more than 2 stars.
author: V W.

description: We loved this place! My boyfriend and I stayed in an AirBNB not too far from here and wound up quickly becoming regulars. We ate here every day because of the convenience, and how good the food actually was. The coffee was great, and we tried many items off of the breakfast menu, including the Haight Scram, the breakfast burrito, and the chicken fried steak to name a few. We'd definitely recommend this place to a friend.
author: Breylan D.

description: I highly recommend the breakfast burrito here & the tater tots :) Instead of having the tots on the side, you can ask them to put it inside of the burrito, which gives it a very unique taste. Also, I love their freshly squeezed orange juice. It just completes your breakfast! But it's always pretty full during peak hours, so it might be hard to find a seat :P
author: Alice H.

description: Bad service.. especially from the "blonde" lady, she was rude.. also she made the worse decaf americano ever.. I knew she made in purpose. This place has good food, but service is terrible
author: Gigi L.

description:
(+) Love the HUGE open window
(+) Great menu selection 
(+) Free wifi
(+)Tasty food, especially portabella  sandwich & curly fries
author: Monica R.

description:
I come here once a week or so for breakfast and coffee when I work from home.

The espresso drinks are pretty good here, as is their hot drop coffee. However I was disappointed with the iced coffee when I ordered it; it didn't seem very fresh.

The food can be pretty hit or miss. I am a huge fan of eggs benedict, and theirs is certainly passable, albeit not spectacular. They poach eggs pretty well, but their hollandaise sauce is sometimes on the tangy side for me, and they don't use very much. Their Denver omelet is quite good!

The staff are always down to earth and friendly.
author: Daniel P.

description: Attention Dog Owners: this is no longer a dog friendly establishment. Take your dogs and your business elsewhere.
author: Michael M.

description: Get a garlic bagel with the pesto cream cheese and your life will forever change. Best bagel breakfast on the west coast! Great cappuccino too.
author: Katherine P.

description:
Holy omelette, Batman, I'm absolutely crazy about this place.

Seriously, one of my biggest disappointments in leaving SF is that I won't have this place around the block anymore. Their menu is enormous, and the lunch and dinner sandwiches are pretty good, but breakfast at The Grind is really where it's at. The omelettes are totally delicious, and I take my eggs very seriously. Excellent toast and I love the hash browns, too (but not so much the home fries). Great bagels, smoothies, they have beer...the list goes on and on and on. Oh, and the staff is really friendly, too.

I should temper my enthusiasm with a disclaimer that I'm very biased; their breakfast is perfect for me, for the way that I like breakfast, which is very very hearty. If you're way into baked goods, then you can do a lot better, and i didn't eat enough eggs cooked any other way but scrambled or in omelette form to have a strong opinion on different preparations. I usually got a Denver omelette or something similar, with hash browns and a bagel, and this breakfast was spot-on for me!

It would merit five stars if it had better lunch which, again, is perfectly fine but not exceptional. Other than that, I'm not huge on their coffee, and I got totally spoiled on fresh-squeezed orange juice in SF so I wish they had that, too. Overall, though, 5+++ stars for breakfast, especially on warm days with the big windows open. It can be very crowded and loud on such days, though, especially on the weekends, something to keep in mind.
author: Rick B.

description:
this is a great start to a fun filled trek down to HA district and if you're really feeling full you can trek all the way to golden gate park and only stop for a bite on your way back home..

I went here on two separate occasions and had breakfast and then had a lunch item. 

   First time was lunch. I ate in their tiny dining area inside. I got a cheeseburger asked for it t medium well although when it came out it was pretty red. Ate it anyway. The bun grilled was nice and this was a big ass burger took half of it home..

 Also got a smoothie. For $4 though I would not get it again.  
It was tiny and not very exciting. ( I got pineapple  coconut).  

The next time I went I ordered breakfast w/ a friend. We sat outside in their cute little dining set up.  

  He got the southwestern omelet as well as a side of corned beef hash which I do not like but he loooooved it and said it was homemade.   I got a the lower haight omelet with hashbroowns which I asked if they could burn a tiny bit and they said yes.  Food came quickly & was tasty. The portions were large (as seen in pictures)

I also got a coconut macaroon to go and it was so big it was heavy like a baseball and half dipped in chocolate.

Another plus here is they have a restroom while many establishments on Haight do not offer one to customers.
author: Augustine W.

description:
This was another recommendation by one of the desk clerks at our hotel (The Metro Hotel). I am SO glad we were given this recommendation!!! The food here was AMAZING!!

I ordered the Haight Scram (avocado, bacon, green onions) and a fruit cup. Both were exceptional! I would definitely go back if I lived nearby!
author: Karina H.

description:
With the good location, full kitchen, and large seating space, this cafe should be a lot better. But most of their cooked food is just a step above cafeteria stuff - packaged food heated up. They have a variety of offerings but I think if they cooked their menu items from scratch and put some love and soul into it, this place would have lines out the door.

The only draw for me are the baked items. You can tell they come from all types of vendors by the different packaging. Some really look homemade, simply in plastic wrap. My favorite are surprisingly the vegan cookies which are the best I've had. They're huge, moist, and flavor combos are perfect. I keep coming back for the vegan banana "chocolate" chip cookie.
author: Mimi L.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and usually call in an order when I get off of the train in the morning for pickup. Food is good but the service is really bad. Maybe this is due to the type of people they have working there. They all seem to be snobby hipsters who would rather be in bed than working except for one guy that usually works in the morning (Mini fro and mustache). he is really nice and speedy. 

I get there to pick up my order and I wait the 15 min they tell me before I arrive and I usually am waiting in line behind people who are in deep conversation with the staff (Young female with glasses). She sees other people waiting in line but still continues to have a conversation with people at the register about nonsense. Finally get to pay for my overpriced meal (usually a burrito) and I still have to wait. 

There is no other place in a four to five block radius open at 7am so I have to either bite my tongue or find a new place. Again, I like the food but the service can be a lot better with faster cooks.
author: Robert Shawn W.

description:
This place used to be my go to. Not any longer. While the counter help
Is friendly the MUSIC SUCKS!!! I don't want to dine to Club Music unless I'm in Miami for WMC.
author: Holly S.

description:
In town for a few days, and The Grind was recommended by our friends who live right around the corner. Described as having "everything you need", from wifi to a great food selection, it did not disappoint in the least. Beautiful day helped as I sat on the patio working, drinking great coffee, and destroying the tasty Scott Street omelet (standard avocado, bacon, and assorted veggies) that was cheerily brought out to me. 
Great cafe is you're looking for something in the area.
author: Dan C.

description:
Downgrading all the way to TWO stars....and believe me, this kitty never goes below 3!!!

So here is the deal. I love the grind. I love the food, the location, the atmosphere, the menu selection, price, and great outdoor seating.

BUT....lets talk about the staff. The dudes who make the food are great. The dudes who bus the tables and bring out food are wonderful and always polite and welcoming. So whats up with the too cool for school Daria style hipster girls who run the counter and make drinks? I can't even believe the robotic and rude service I receive, or at least observe other customers receive on a regular basis.They make this place such a drag, and make me feel like I'm inconveniencing their whole life and causing them horrible pain when I try to order a simple coffee and a breakfast sandwich. I'm sorry that you have 8 people in line and that you still haven't found a ticket for coachella, but I really just want to get my americano and get on with my day without felling bummed out by your negative energy.

Overall I still like the place, and will probably still pop my tail in from time to time, but I'll always have to make sure to make a stop at the vapor room before hand so I'll be chilled out enough to deal with these folks.
author: Meowy C.

description: OMG I come to this cafe all the time. I spend money here practically every day, eat here, order coffee here on an almost daily basis and I was just told that I need to order something or move on. I know they are busy but I also support them a lot. I already ordered bfast here an hour ago and was just enjoying a coffee when the girl came by to tell me they are shutting off the wifi. So insulted. Not sure if I will ever come here again now.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Great waffle & decent omelet.  My mocha was very good.  

It was a bit cold in this restaurant and I could not hear who I was with.
author: Carb Q.

description:
This cafe holds a very special place in my heart. 
Highly Recommended!
author: Ryan L.

description:
This is a solid neighborhood cafe: good food (eggs, bagels, sandwiches, etc.) tea/coffee and pastries/desserts. Sometimes, there is a bit of a wait to order, but that - and their tendency to host loud rugrats early on weekend mornings - are the only not-great things I can say about them. 

Everything I've ordered there has been good or better, whether that was eggs, a bagel with peanut butter, just a beverage or a rice krispie treat. I've always received great service, with the most memorable being the girl at the cash register who gave me helpful hints when I was first moving into the neighborhood. Every house guest I sent to the Grind was satisfied, despite their varying ages, occupations, food preferences, etc. This is a good choice, when you're in the area.
author: Novelty B.

description:
The Pineapple Coconut smoothie here is amazing. I was super refreshed after having one, 

The Sicilian Omelette is really good too. Now how come I didn't give this review more stars...

Because I found a small 'screw' in my smoothie. I couldn't believe it, tasted great, but finding the screw inside was troublesome. 

I would recommend anybody to try a smoothie here, just beware. You've been warned.
author: Maximilian R.

description: I stopped by for breakfast and was pleased with my scramble and macchiato. Almost too many menu choices but if I lived in the neighborhood that'd only make me want to stop by more. Super friendly service, too.
author: Sheri G.

description:
service: bad. rude waitor and standoffish waitress.
price: cheap, considering the portion especially.
food: very average.  you could make better waffles at home.  nothing surprising.
SPACE:  loud and convenient space. flies all around outdoor seating
author: Shuting Z.

description:
This is a regular stop for me (once or twice a week) for a quiet place to sit and read, while eating some tasty food stuffs. 
The Haight scram is a favorite, also the croissant french toast, and the amazing orange juice! 

Prices are good for the portion sizes, and the staff is always very nice and accommodating. 
Definitely will continue to be my "go-to" until I move out of the lower Haight.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Oh, the Grind. I've only been here twice and I really love your salads but...why is there always hair in your food? 

Seriously? The first time, I had a couple of bites and found a hair buried halfway beneath the lettuce. I was pretty grossed out and tossed the whole thing away, but accounted it to a one time error.

Came by and got another salad to-go this time, and was happily munching away until near the very end when I found yet another hair clinging to the walls of the box. I wonder if I've already accidentally ingested some. 

One of the staff needs to condition or change shampoos because, yo, your hair keeps breaking off in people's food and I'm bummed out by buying food I can't finish cause yknow...it's kind of unappetizing. Is there a hair monster flying all over the place back there?

Either the Grind hates me and is trying to sabotage or, they need to step up their sanitation, yo.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Was craving a breakfast burrito and this place came up on yelp and it was only a few blocks away...it was awesome! ask them to put the hash browns inside the burrito and pick your choice of meat...I chose the chicken apple sausage. Yum! 

I've actually split the burrito with someone and it was plenty for breakfast! 

Us Americans eat too much some times! 

Shame on me, I can't believe I just said that.
author: Philip H.

description: I stop in at The Grind from time to time to usually grab a coffee and a quick bite to eat before heading somewhere. The service is just ok -- for some reason every time I order their home fries (or whatever those little potatos are called), I end up getting hash browns. Never fails and always lets me down.
author: Lee L.

description: Wanted eggs for breakfast and the hotel pointed us here. Ice counter service and clean bright eating area. My sunny side up eggs were just right and the hash browns crispy. Would come back.
author: Ted B.

description: I really want to give the grind 4 stars, but I can't. Every time I've been there since they reopened, the service was slow and the food was mediocre at best. 3 out of 3 visits, it took over 40 minutes to receive our food after ordering, and other customers who ordered after us got their food before us. This is my neighborhood cafe so I hope they are able to bring their service and food quality back up to what it once was, so that I have another solid place for brunch.
author: Brian O.

description: Been here once and I can not wait to come back!! I was on vacation and while visiting San Francisco, me and my family had a quick bite. We all had burgers and fries. Their bacon cheeseburger and sweet potato fries are amazing!! Perfect place for friends to chat and have a bite. Staff is friendly. Very hipster neighborhood. Casual attire. The menu was endless! I'm a New Yorker so I know good food and this is GREAT food!
author: Ulep P.

description: They have Sriracha... Just ask!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
The food here is kind of just alright.  Very no-frills. I like their salads because they are huge, and salads are always healthy, right guys? Right?!

Anyway I like the Chinese chicken salad the most.  Their brunch is okay as well, nothing to write home about but will definitely satisfy the brunch cravings you have if you're in a pinch.
author: jon y.

description: Great Sandwiches. Very quick. One Star off because of a lot flies outside, enjoying spilled beer, or something. Must have been there for a while. Nevertheless nice food, nice staff, everything fine!
author: Jörg H.

description: Recently moved right across the street from this place and it is a great one to have so close. Quick service, strong cold brew and house coffee, provide soy milk with no extra fee, omelette variety is great and I have had 2 which have been delicious. The Sicilian is a must (pesto and sun dried tomatoes). They offer mimosa for $4 a glass and I was introduced to a new style mixed with a splash of lemonade. They have a cute front patio to catch a nice breeze or people watch down the busy haight street. I live in the neighborhood as well and can say parking is typically pretty easy to find. Additionally my roomie who is a breakfast burriot guru has said it is one of the best :)
author: Michelle R.

description:
Let's start with the premise that you want some good food close by in the Lower Haight - lunch, brunch, or an early dinner - or just a coffee, tea, or smoothie. This is a place that does all of them well, in a neighborhood where most people want them sometimes, and sometimes many people want them at the same time. The result is: not enough space during peak times. Just remember that all the tables close together, inside and out, are necessary. You'll appreciate them more if you have to wait. In general though, people don't dawdle too much after they've finished and it's really busy. 

Just so you know: Order at the register, go up your drinks from the counter, and eventually bus your table...*but* you'll have food brought to the table thanks to the little numbered sign. 

Their breakfast burrito is big and darn good. Really enjoyed the omelette too. Good-sized portions for all plates, whether or not you're hung over. Good coffee and DIY water. OJ was fine. I've also had the jungle juice smoothie, which is a solid green but has a fruity-banana flavor - it's excellent. 

If you need wireless, be warned that it can be slow with several users at once. Just play nicely (be considerate of your usage) and everyone should get along fine.
author: Mike H.

description:
Sundays are my Fridays and working the overnight shift, Sunday mornings are my Friday nights.  (Are you following?)  So what else to do on a "Friday night" but go grab a bite on the town.  By town I mean an emerging from slumber, cloudy San Francisco.  By bite I mean breakfast, naturally.

There was a sports bar I wanted to check out for some NFL action in the area, so luckily I also came across The Grind Cafe to get my fill ahead of time.  This place is a hub of activity on a Sunday morning.  Families with their kids, students with their notebooks, young adults knocking out the cobwebs, SFPD officers on their break and guys like me just looking for something new.  A patchwork of people coexisting in a big city.

This is one of those places where you pay in advance and then they bring you your food.  You might want to study the menu ahead of time.  It's vast and you can feel rushed trying to decide what to get at the counter with a steady line of folks behind you.

I went with the croissant french toast, a couple of scrambled eggs and a glass of apple juice.  The juice seemed natural with that darker, cloudier look rather than that pretty almost clear stuff you get in a bottle at Safeway.  Eggs cooked to perfection, though I could have used some shredded cheese on top.  French toast was a couple of big croissants sliced in two and cooked in the classic batter.  All very good.  It's not too cheap but you can get what you need with less than $20 in your pocket.

I'd definitely come back here and try some other stuff on the menu.  Friendly service and a definite neighborhood feel.  Plenty of tv's tuned to NFL pre-game show too, so that's always a plus.
author: Bennett L.

description:
Took my mom for a quick breakfast bite and thought the food was P-R-I-M-E.
We both ordered the Sicilian omelet, which was served with wheat toast and hash browns. 

I was happy because they serve mimosas!

Staff was friendly, patient, and made a great recommendation!
author: Ashley G.

description:
The Grind offers many different options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Whatever you're in the mood for they probably have. To me, it's kinda like the People's Cafe (RIP) of the Lower Haight. 

The boyfriend and I came in for brunch and were greeted with kind service. After a few minutes looking over the huge menu, we went for breakfast dishes. He had the corned beef hash with hash browns and I had the veggie scramble with home fries. The veggie scramble was made with mushrooms, onions, and tomatoes and covered in melted cheddar cheese. I thought it was pretty average, but it was nothing special -  did the job though! The boy liked his corned beef hash but wished that he had gone with the home fries, which were really delicious! 

Overall, I would definitely come here again. There's tons of options and I like the whole casual, neighborhood kinda vibe that it has. However, with tons of other options in the area and in the city, The Grind isn't at the top of my list.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I wish this one star review had gotten me my food about an hour and a half faster. Over an hour and 15 minutes were spent expecting our food last Saturday. Usually I never rate things based on one bad experience, but in this case I was actually so upset that I probably won't ever go back. I talked to 3 different employees after an hour who all sounded eager to help, yet were unwilling to do anything except make sure we place our order. If you are going to take over an hour just to get to starting to make someone's food, you should at least let the customer know or put up a sign. So here is the sign. Please expect to wait over an hour, and if you want to get your average food in reasonable time, just go somewhere else
author: Ryan R.

description: Get some work done or meet a friend.... easy going staff and chill atmosphere. Servers good coffee and they have a nice selection of healthy and naughty options to eat....Try the Big Rice Krispy squares... :)
author: Victoria B.

description:
The only reason I'm giving two stars and not one is because the girls who work here are really sweet.

I come here for my almost daily coffee because it's on the way to the bus stop. Otherwise, I would avoid it and get my coffee elsewhere. The coffee is mediocre and usually far too hot (burnt).

But the worst, is the food. I don't really understand how this place has so many good reviews for the food. It's tasteless, poorly seasoned, off the back of a truck, boxed, frozen, crapola. In a city with so many local options for bread, cheese, meats, etc. it's a shame that they don't take advantage and get an edge in the neighborhood. 

Go to the cafes around Divis + Oak or Fillmore + Haight for better food + coffee.
author: A S.

description: Neighborhood casual- just like squat and gobble or crepe vine. Good food, fast service. Hash browns are delicious, pancakes so so. I've loved all the bagel options! They have a coffee punch card, and a great place to sit outside and people watch or gab on the phone.
author: Kira M.

description: Not your typical coffee shop. The food is amazing and high quality for a great price. Staff is nice but could drop a little of the attitude. That's the only reason for the four stars. It can get a little crowded on weekends but where doesn't it get crowded on weekends.
author: Isaac B.

description: Hit this place after getting pampered at the Spa.  Good pear and cranberry salad and great environment.  If I'd live closer, I would definitely come here more often for coffee by myself to read a book, or work on my laptop.  Highly recommended.
author: Paige J.

description: The Grind is a go-to spot for reasonably priced, delicious, and basic breakfast.  I have been here many many times and the service is always fast and friendly.  Don't be deterred by long lines and an appearance of lack of available tables because everything moves swiftly and a seat will open for  you by the time you've ordered.  I've only been here for breakfast so I can't speak for lunchtime meals.  My favorite is the breakfast burrito with sautéed spinach and mushrooms instead of meat.  The people taking the orders are always gracious when I request my substitution.  My boyfriend always gets the corned beef hash or country fried chicken and they're both super yummy.  They have a patio if you prefer to eat outside on a nice morning.
author: Jessica L.

description: Simple but delicious food. I've never had a bad dish at The Grind. I love going there for breakfast (great bagel sandwiches and chai), and lunch (sandwiches with really good bread). If I ever wake up early enough to grab breakfast before work, this is my go to place.  It's also great for weekends. They have a small patio/porch area in front and the entire front window opens up on nice days.
author: Madeline K.

description:
This cafe was my hangover cure after a busy night out!  It was busy inside, but not crazy-loud, and staff were brilliant.

I had one of the best bloody marys ever here, and I'm really picky about that cocktail.  It was made with clamato juice, I think, and had that wonderful hair of the dog depth to it that brought me back to earth from the tummy ache hell I was in.

I got the tuna salad bagel sandwich, which was so, so good.  Even the pickle that came with it was delicious!  Plus, the prices are really, really reasonable.  I will definitely stop by here the next time I'm in SF.

Parking is a pain, so be sure to look around the side streets for more realistic options.
author: Katie M.

description:
This place is indeed, As good as it gets! Huge amazing delicious menu full of scrumptious options from omelets and scrambles to all types of sandwiches and salads, croissant French Toast and peanut butter and banana bagel.

The portions are generous and everything is properly made. The sandwiches are loaded with meat and fixings (nothing worse the a skimpy sandwich) as is everything else. They have great coffee, drinks and amazing looking pastries and snacks. 

This is a perfect place for a great breakfast or lunch with friends and everything is reasonably priced (nothing over $10)
author: Uriah B.

description:
Anytime I go out to breakfast, I consistently have the dilemma that I want French toast, but I also want the traditional breakfast of eggs, toast, and bacon. 

This place has that on one plate!

When my food arrived, my boyfriend took one look and said "Umm, next time I'm getting THAT." ( The Grind Combo, if you're wondering)

My latte was very good, and seriously their menu is huge and everything sounds really good. Plus the outdoor seating is where it's at.

Oh and the staff is actually FRIENDLY. A smile while taking your order goes a long way.
author: Alyssa G.

description: Obviously a busy brunch place after they received a little press from the remodel. However, I ordered two food items and a cafe au lait. Nearly one hour later spoke with a young woman who provided me with my cold egg and my prompt refund. I will try again when they get their mojo back.
author: Vincent P.

description: I love the atmosphere here. It's so chill and there pastries and desserts are bomb. I always come back for the cinammon crumble cake. Their godfather omelette is pretty good too. Fun to come on a weekend during breakfast/brunch time.
author: Hoosie U.

description: Service is pretty bad. Asked to split the tab (between 2 credit cards) and was told to "figure it out later". Okaaaay
author: Ian T.

description:
There is nothing special about the Grind. It's mediocre brunch and lunch food with the added bonus that sometimes I'm too lazy to walk an extra 4 blocks to better restaurants and it's RIGHT. THERE.

I feel the prices are too high for the quality of food they have. This is based mostly on the fact that they can't properly make eggs sunny-side up without over or under cooking them. They also don't have poached eggs here. Call it snobby but I think not having poached eggs on a menu is an abomination.

They do make a mean, delicious bloody mary. Unfortunately with soju and not vodka. Strike two, guys. Their wifi only works half of the time so I'm always wondering what everyone on their laptop is doing without internet.
author: Michelle N.

description: The grind is a solid neighborhood eating option. Don't expect to be blown away, but the food is good and you won't have to wait in an hour long line. I'd recommend the breakfast burrito or sandwich, both are go tos for me if I need a quick hungover breakfast.
author: Josh Y.

description: I ordered the french toast with bananas. Delicious. Made it just in time before the line started creeping out the door, but it would have been worth a ten minute wait. Great service too!
author: Jen L.

description:
Oh the GRIND.. how I miss living next door and rolling out of bed to come over on the weekends for an awesome hung-over breakfast. 

I miss the corned beef hash, omlets and yummy baked goods. I've never been for lunch or dinner but go for breakfast/brunch. It really is fantastic.
author: Sandy H.

description:
Love a lil place with outdoor seating on the four sunny days/year here in SF. No, but really, it's a cute place, it's not claustrophobic like so many other cafes, great selection, nice servers. Food looked good, though I didn't eat. I'll go back, though, it's nice to have another great meeting place in my arsenal.

More plusses: Decent kids menu, location.
Minus: Lower Haight's terrible cell reception.
author: kat g.

description: Sometimes takes a bit long to get prepared, but overall great food!
author: Ahmed A.

description:
Breakfast meeting. yum. I love to have both savory and sweet, so my coworker and I decided to split an Omelette and French Toast. Early enough to serve us before we head to work. Like their little outdoor patio area. Perfect for those sunny days.

Omelette with potato fingerlings 
The omelette was good and very filling with the potato fingerlings. I'm glad I only had half.

French toast with potato hash 
I absolutely LOVELOVELOVE french toast and I swear I finished every piece of my share. Fingerlicking good. YUM!
author: Sarah F.

description: Love the grind!!! Love love love it.  It's our baby friendly consistently delicious breakfast spot.  The breakfast burrito is off the chain.  The only thing I wish they  change is that they would get a memory button on the computer and just enter my order when I come In the door.
author: ari b.

description:
Killer breakfast stuff. Cool coffee goodness. We will be back. 

Nice patio seating area and nice ambiance. I really liked the breakfast burrito. Friends had omelets and scrambles, all of which looked great and everyone liked. A few locals were with us and directed us here, it was a good call overall and one everyone was happy with. 

We'll be back!
author: B H.

description: Young lady at the counter was charming and pleasant at 7 am, so no problem there. Coffee is just fair, while the Haight Scram was a mess of goodness. Check it out; cool vibe.
author: Michael S.

description: The Grind is our weekend ritual. The breakfast burrito -- with veggie sausage and hash browns and avocado, sans egg -- is the best one in the city. Their sandwiches are delicious, great French Toast and the Hash Brown Hill is to die for. And they are always so sweet to us at the counter. This place is solid.
author: Elinor M.

description: The food is great and the smoothies are a must-have! Outdoor seating on a sunny day can't be beat!
author: John C.

description:
Had an amazing Feta/spinach/sun-dried tomato omelette here. The hash browns and homestyle potatoes leave a bit to be desired though. There wasn't even bell peppers in the homestyle potatoes! With how good the omelette was, however, I can forgive this flaw. 

The menu had several options. I had trouble figuring out exactly what I wanted because a lot of it sounded good.

The place itself is right on Haight. There a patio area right next to the street or you can eat inside. Eating outside is a nice relaxing way to start the morning. We walked from our hotel our last day in San Francisco.

The service was a little odd, but I think that was mostly one worker who didn't want to be there.
author: David A.

description: Came here for a quick breakfast and enjoyed everything. We ordered the orange juice, coffee, and two bagels with cream cheese. The salmon cream cheese has large pieces of salmon inside! I'd order that again.
author: Tomas P.

description: very friendly staff. I recommend this place. great veg.it can little busy some times
author: B H.

description:
The Grind reminds me of Squat and Gobble, The Grove, and Crepeville. These are the Cheesecake Factories* of brunch places-- You go not because the food is particularly good, but because you're sure that everyone in your group will at least find something tolerable to eat. There aren't that many brunch places in Lower Haight (Kate's Kitchen and Squat and Gobble might be the only other options), so you'll probably find yourself at The Grind at some point...



*Key differences b/t these places and Cheesecake Factory: the 100+ option menu is written on a chalkboard above the cash register, you order at counter and seat yourself at a table, and crepes instead of cheesecake.
author: Elaine C.

description: Turkey bacon melt with Caesar salad! Yuum
author: Ketki W.

description:
Pros: Lot's of seating, a number of outlets, friendly staff, good quality food and a good selection, tasty breads. but

Cons: wifi is a little slow and sometimes unreliable and the atmosphere, is lacking character.
author: Karl S.

description:
I haven't tried much on the menu here but I have to give this place 5 starts because it is my favorite breakfast burrito in the city!

I love to get it with sausage- whatever kind they use is great...Plus sour cream, avocado, perfectly cooked eggs, great salsa, cheese...its fantastic.  I ask for an extra side of their spicy pico de gallo.  Order their breakfast potatoes extra crispy for the choice of side...it's always been consistent for me and it always taste just as delicious as the first time.
author: Laura L.

description:
Prettah goohd.  

Fast, fresh, moderately priced, beer, wine, freezing tea, good service, bread was stale, I don't like too much light at night inside because then my eyes have to adjust, has a bathroom, quiet, want to go back for breakfast, saw someone else's strawberry pancakes and wanted to steal them, stop.
author: Allie O.

description:
I really like this place. It may be that it's so close to my house, but I absolutely love it. The food isn't going to knock your socks off, but it's pretty good. My favorite is the croissant french toast. Yes, you read that right. I'll give you a second to ponder and recover.

Even though this place is usually pretty crowded, wait it out and be like a panther - You can find a spot.
author: Jenny J.

description: The prices are really decent here and the selection of brunch items is overwhelming. I ended up getting the classic two eggs, toast and hash browns deal. My friend got French Toast which looked super tasty. There was a lot on her plate too. Portions are generous so plan accordingly. Service is fast and seating can be tricky depending on how busy they get. I would definitely stop in here again.
author: Amy J.

description: This place has awesome french toast! dank to the max and beyond. The staff is really friendly too and there's good atmosphere as well. will be going back.
author: Drawing G.

description:
I went here after a long night of partying, and in all honesty I wasn't too thrilled when I walked inside and saw so many people there... Maybe this is because I'm too used  to the LA cafe scene, where many patrons=a huge racket, and you barely get to enjoy your food and drinks. However, this place was bumping, but not too loud. Strange, but amazing. I secured a table with my friends and everything was good to go.

I ordered some ice tea and a grilled chicken sandwich- I was going to order a side of sweet potato fries, but she kindly let me know that I could switch my side (that came with my sandwich) for sweet potatoes. The chicken was grilled to perfection, the sandwich was packed with yummy veggies, and the bread was tasty too. I couldn't ask for a better brunch!

I really, really wish there were more places like The Grind in LA, I miss it so much already!
author: Emi T.

description: The Grind was my first San Francisco love. The girls at the counter are delightful, friendly and sweet. The food is hearty and healthy. The place is mostly a breakfast and lunch local hang. The coffee is perfect and rich. The food is always well prepared with the tastiest ingredients . A regular for me is a bagel sandwiches. I usually have a everything bagel with chicken apple sausage, swiss, scrambled eggs and tomato. Sometime I switch the cheeses around to keep it fresh. Other items that I'm really fond of are the Haight Street, Sicilian or the South Western omelet. You can't miss great food at a fair price with a solid coffee house vibe in a very tradition manner. The romance continue for some time to come!
author: Billy B.

description: I had breakfast here with a friend a few days ago and it was definitely the perfect place to go after a wild sunday funday. There is indoor and outdoor seating with large windows. You order your food at the counter and then they will bring the food to your table. I had the tofu scramble ($8.75) which came with hash browns and toast. I also got a glass of orange juice ($2.95). All of the food was great and I will definitely hit this place up for breakfast again sometime soon!
author: Anthony H.

description: Had the pulled pork sandwich with fries.  It was good, though I thought the sauce a bit sweet.  The place looked nice and had a good selection, but for this item, I was not wowed, though it was acceptable.  I would return to try again.  Prices reasonable.
author: Marc S.

description: Nice brunch place in Lower Haight with a huge menu. It can be really crowded in the morning. The service is pretty slow though
author: Igor P.

description:
Lower Haight. A great neighborhood, and a great café.

The staff are uniformly friendly and welcoming, the food is great - try the BLTA - and filling, and the coffee, chai, and the spiced cider are just wonderful and inexpensive!

Plentiful and fast Wi-Fi.

The only downside is it's on the wrong side of the street, so it never gets warmed by the sunlight. I guess this is a plus on sweltering days, but somewhat daunting on those frosty ones. Or don't be dumb (like I am) and stop sitting outside. But I like sitting outside, watching the parade of humanity march by...
author: Michael S.

description: Amazing! Hands down best breakfast place ever! From French toast, bacon, waffles, sandwiches, fruit, burritos... Everything is bomb... Love taking all my friends who don't live nearby here!
author: Alan M.

description: The Grind is definitely a place to go to when you want a leisurely breakfast or lunch. Today was my second time coming to the Grind. The last time I went, my baby and I just had tea and pumpkin bread(which is good). This time I had the lox scramble. If you love lox, you must come here. You know how on some breakfast scrambles, the goodies are mixed quickly so the tomatoes(or whatever goodies you order) are mostly in one side? Well this scramble had omelet, lox, cream cheese, tomatoes, green onions and capers in every bite. It was cut up and mixed thoroughly. Each forkful was paradise. I enjoyed this scramble with my perfectly toasted buttered wheat bread and hash browns. The portions are huge. The food is delicious. Can't wait to come back!
author: Caroline N.

description: I almost don't want to review The Grind because I want to keep it a secret.  Food is always good, awesome selection, really nice employees.  Sure, it gets really busy but it is worth it.  They recently remodeled and it looks way better, that's just a bonus.  Every once and a while they might forget something on my order but are always quick to fix it.  They also don't get mad when I order specialized coffee drinks from the bar.  Very accommodating.  Just keep in mind it might be crazy on the weekend, especially for brunch, and you might have to wait in line and wait for a table, but that certainly doesn't keep me from coming back.
author: Lauren B.

description: Nothing to be upset about here. The staff is friendly and very kind. We had breakfast here this morning on the patio...with doggies too and it was super fun! I had the Scott Street Omelette----pretty darn good and huge. I had a bite of my friend's croissant french toast and if I was walking 50 miles a week like she does I would have eaten the entire plate! The food here is solid. Great atmosphere...especially on a 420 weekend!
author: Sherie R.

description:
Had breakfast here over the weekend and it was really good!  I had eggs, chicken apple sausage and an engligh muffin-my husband had the scramble with chicken apple sausage, spinach, sun dried tomatoes and feta.  His was delicious!  I loved the combination and the balance of flavors all wrapped up in egg.  My latte was delicious also.  
Great location with plenty of on street parking at 8 am on a Sunday.
author: Karen H.

description: Delicious sandwiches & breakfasts, friendly & attentive staff, free wifi. Recently renovated. Also have beer + wine ! Really affordable prices.
author: Leo L.

description: This was my first time here I had the hashbrown mountain I think it was pretty good decent portion for a reasonable price food only took about ten minutes the only reason why I gave it 3 stars was the  fruit belgin waffle , it was okay, but it was Dry and the fruits wernt fresh they were pretty old it kinda killed the whole thing .. but I will give this place another try ..
author: Abe M.

description: The kind of coffee shop I'd open myself. Reasonably priced food, good coffee (I had a latte and it was delicious), hassle-free wi-fi, outdoor seating and good people-watching.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I like this place.  The food is good, if not anything special, but the service is great,  and the people who work there are always polite and never give me a hard time when I ask to substitute avocado for the breakfast potatoes that would ordinarily come with my scrambled eggs.

Did I mention this is a great place to go for breakfast?

It's bigger than many neighborhood coffeehouses/breakfast joints, and has the distinction of NOT being a chain, like Crepevine or Squat'n'Gobble (although it's also a counter-service place).  So it's a nice meeting place to go with friends, with some fabulous covered outdoor seating incorporated into the front of the restaurant, which is very pleasant.

The Grind was recently renovated, and so the flooring, etc. are all new.  I'm not sure, but I think they also repainted, and replaced some of the seating.  Generally speaking, though, it's a pleasant atmosphere, with a lot of natural light pouring in from that front porch.

Overall, there's nothing special about the menu here or the food in general...but it's clean environment, always has a table available when I go there, so I am happy to continue to give this place my business.
author: Amy L.

description:
I come here at least two Sundays a month, maybe three. Perfect since its about 5 blocks from my place.  My routine usually goes like this, grab my laptop (they have free wireless) or a book.  Head down and order one of the egg specials.   You can roll in here solo, with your significant other, family or friends.  Its an all around people friendly joint.  The staff is also very cordial and welcoming.  It gets a bit crowded but don't fret I've never had a problem getting a seat.  The omelets and breakfast specials are perfect after crazy night out, they are also perfect after a quiet night in.  

So there you have it, its a no-nonsense breakfast joint, let's keep it that way!
author: Kristin Marie S.

description: I've been coming here for about 5 years. The food is awesome, the staff is awesome, and the outdoor seating is awesome. Although, I wouldn't recommend coming here on a Sat/Sun between 11am-1pm if you don't like waiting in line.
author: Erika D.

description: Mmm bacon chicken ranch. (Still worth it even when they fuck up the order every time. Usually leaving off the cheese, sometimes the bacon or the ranch or all three. They give us a new sandwich, but that has to be adding up.)
author: Heather R.

description: Great coffee and great food.  There's a reason why the lines can sometimes be a little long on the weekends.  Love the scramblers and hash browns.
author: Louis D.

description:
This place immediately stands out walking down Haight Street because as you see in the pictures they have an outdoor patio area at the entrance.

Pretty large place inside with lots of tables and great options for breakfast and lunch.

Wifi available makes it a good option to drop in with the laptop for a solo lunch.

Definitely on my agenda to have breakfast here one morning.
author: Mitch M.

description:
First of all, lemme preface this with my "I don't drink coffee" disclaimer and tell you right now, I have NO idea if the coffee here is worth your time because... well... I don't drink coffee. 

Now, moving on to what's important... FOOD.

I ate breakfast here twice in the two days I was in town. Day one, I got the breakfast sandwich (egg, sausage & cheese on a croissant) which you can pretty much customize to have whatever you want. That's pretty hard to mess up since it's got exactly what you want on it but it was quite tasty. The hash browns are also quite yummy.

Second day, I had the Grind Combo (I believe that's what it's called), and although it wasn't a fancy order at all, everything was quite tasty. The french toast was quite good, which is impressive because I think most places overdo it with the egg then cover them in powdered sugar like we're at Cafe du Monde or something. This place did them quite nicely. The country potatoes were also good. 

I also must say this about the staff; they are really nice. They may be granola-crunching hippies (let's face it, they're everywhere around here) but they were super sweet and very quick with the drinks and the food.
author: Edgar S.

description: Have gone here for years and the food has always been good. That said, this review is not about the food. I was there this morning with my friend who has a small service dog. We were sitting on the patio portion with the dog when a woman who works there came out and told him the dog had to leave. He said he is a service dog and she said he still had to go. My friend pointed that it is illegal for them to not let him have his service animal with him. The woman claimed that it didn't matter and because of the health code. They calmly went back and forth over it again and again until she got mad and walked away. He pointed out that the sign they have hung up even says service dogs are ok, but she wouldn't come back out of the restaurant to look at the sign. I only post this so the people at the grind will educate their employees about what a service dog is and why they are allowed.
author: Christopher M.

description: Came here for lunch on a Saturday and it was packed (good sign for a first timer) but not so much so that we werent able to find a table easily. I wish I got a dessert because they all looked soooo good especially the rice krispy treats. I got a french dip and it was SO GOOD! the meat was so perfect and the sauce was nice and hot and the cheese was delish. Really emjoyed it. Need more bathrooms would be my only complaint
author: Alexandra W.

description: Masters of inefficiency. Had to wait 30 mins for granola to go. The service here is consistently terrible, but especially in the mornings and on the weekends. I would avoid dining here for any meal unless you have a significant amount of time to kill.
author: Brian K.

description:
Let me count the ways I love The Grind:
1. Great breakfast/lunch menu with something for everyone
2. The perfect balance of price and quality
3. Outdoor seating!
4. A glass front that provides great lighting and can be opened on warmer days
5. Great coffee, tea and fresh squeezed OJ
6. I've been here many many times and not once have they gotten my order wrong
7. Even when it's crowded they get orders out relatively quickly
8. Friendly cashiers
9. The Lower Haight omelet
10. It's two blocks from my apartment

I could go on but you get the point. I love this place, and I'll miss it dearly when I'm no longer in the neighborhood.
author: Joshua K.

description: A great neighborhood cafe. Yummy food with generous portions. Counter staff is outstanding; friendly and helpful. The owner is heavily involved and swings through several times a day, a key reason for their success I'm sure. He must treat his employees well as many of the same kitchen and counter workers have been there for years.
author: Paul W.

description: A great place to go for breakfast and read a book, especially on a weekday.
author: Nathan R.

description:
Good food, good environment, good neighborhood.


The Grind Cafe has been delightful for my lazy mornings in Lower Haight. The Barista always manages to make a great latte, and the people that work there look like they enjoy working there (why is that hard to come by these days?). My boyfriend ordered some gnarly nutella waffle, and I ordered french toast. THE FRENCH TOAST is amazing!!! 

I went back again and tried the egg sandwich and it was perfect. The portions aren't too big, like most breakfast restaurants, and the prices are reasonable. 

I'll be back again. and again.
author: Shel Z.

description: When you wake up at 5am San Francisco time, which is actually 8am NY time you start to think about breakfast. My husband and I found The Grind Cafe opened at 7am with rave reviews. I can only add to the rave reviews. I had the Haight scram which is scrambled eggs with avocado, bacon and cheddar cheese. Outrageous! There coffee and multigrain bread was delicious also. A great little find in the area.
author: Mrs. M.

description: I LOVE the grind! Not only is it a half block away from my house, the food is great, service is great and they make my quad soy lattes absolutely perfect. Thanks for being amazing guys;)
author: Monica H.

description:
One of my favorite breakfast places in the city. The servings are big and the food comes out fast! Get the breakfast sandwich and the hash-browns, you will be in breakfast heaven.

I think the reason this place isn't rated higher is because it doesn't look like your typical trendy hole in the wall brunch joint -- but it deserves to have the ratings as such.
author: Leo C.

description:
If 3.5 stars was an option, I'd choose that, but I'm feeling generous and rounded up to 4 stars since The Grind serves breakfast all day!

I used to live in Lower Haight, and let's just say that The Grind has gotten a LOT of business from me over the past three years.  My other half insisted that the group of 6 of us walk 1+ mile several hours into Bay to Breakers so he could get his Grind fix.  I'm not sure it's THAT good, but it did help with our impending Bay to Breakers mid-afternoon hangover that comes with starting to celebrate at 7:30 am.

Run-down:
- large portions
- large variety of both breakfast and lunch/dinner options
- prices low enough that it doesn't feel like breaking the bank to eat here often
- I like the breakfast offerings more than the lunch/dinner ones
- although it gets crowded on the weekend for brunch, I've never had problems getting a table by the time my food is ready
- every once in a while, the kitchen gets really backed up and takes a while to get food to the table
- one food-related gripe is I don't like how the egg scrambles just have the cheese melted on top rather than mixed into the scramble, but that's more my preference than something "wrong" with the dish.

My go-to dish here: french toast with mixed fresh fruit OR breakfast burrito if I'm in a savory food kind of mood
author: Kathleen H.

description:
Outdoor seating.  That's the main reason I go.
They also have a good variety of fresh lunch and breakfast food, as well as baked goods.  I also enjoy the stack of SF Weeklys at the door.
author: Kristin K.

description:
I love this place! The food is super yummy I even get their salsa and pesto to go sometimes because it's the best. It's a perfect spot to just chill and sip on the loveliest of drinks made by the loveliest of ladies. I always get a wrapped pastry and store it in my purse for later cravings. 

They cater to vegans/vegetarians too...soy milk, vegan pastries, and I've also seen gluten free stuff in there before too. Check it out!
author: Caitlin B.

description: It's a cute spot to sit and do some light work while enjoying a cup of coffee. I had a white mocha - it wasn't the best, but it wasn't the worst. The location is good! After you enjoy your coffee you can just walk to haight and go shopping :) Woo!
author: Lauren N.

description:
- food:  fresh food with a lot of choices
- atmosphere:  casual / neighborhood place
- staff:  hipster and friendly
- price:  reasonable

additional info:
- bus your own table
author: J. B.

description: The food here is good enough and the staff are all really nice, so I like coming here. One thing though- if you call food in for pickup and they tell you the amount of time, double it, at least. They've told me 15 and it's taken 40. Also, the menu on the website is not up to date, so be ready with a second option. I still come here though, I like the salads and they have some good vegetarian sandwiches
author: Sarah V.

description:
This place has overall amazing food. Is quick, fresh and the portions are huge, good enough to share. I'm so glad our local friends decided to take us here.

We had the breakfast burrito, lower haight omelet and strawberry banana waffle, and they were all amazing. I must say I was most impressed about the breakfast burrito of all, one of the best I've had.

We got pretty lucky on the table situation, since the place is pretty crowded on the weekends. So that worked out well thankfully.
author: Regina B.

description: I went here today and got an iced coffee.  I ordered a large and I thought it was on the small side.  But for $2 I thought it was a fair price (and the cup was really cool).  It was super delicious and I want to go back already.  Cool spot, stoners and SFPD officers sippin coffee together in peace and harmony.  Haight Street... gotta love it.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
First time experience.

This is my favorite breakfast spot to eat at when I'm staying at the Metro Hotel.
My girlfriend and I visited this place a few times during our stay in San Francisco.
I fell in love with their croissant french toast. Adding fresh strawberries to it made it really delicious. I chose to get their homestyle fries instead of the hash browns. The homestyle fries were decent.
I also went with their lattes. Coffee is made fairly quick, before your food is brought out to you. Food is made fairly quickly and brought out to you by friendly staff.
Overall the staff is friendly and are quick to serve you.
The atmosphere is somewhat quiet to average noise levels.
The place also has large windows which brings in great ambient light.
It's a great place to sit down and eat so you can enjoy your morning.
There is free wi-fi but limited on the weekends.
This place is very convenient if you're staying at the Metro Hotel. Just a short walk away.
Prices are fair for what you receive.

The Grind Cafe is our favorite new place for breakfast.
But will also continue to come back to try their lunch menu.
author: John S.

description: Solid 4 star. Good food, not amazing. Pay before you sit, wait 5 minutes and then eat. Very generous portions of coffee, great if you're on a budget and want some decent food!
author: Alexander G.

description:
I've only been for breakfast as it is around the corner from my place, but have had the Veggie Scram and the Haight Scram, both of which are excellent and come with great potatoes and some toast. The breakfast burrito is great also, abeit a little spicy but that is probably just me. Definitely big portions and very fast service. And I like that they have little packets of blackberry jam, not just strawberry, because blackberry is my favorite!

Coffee is okay...not sure what kind they brew here, not my favorite, but they have a large assortment of other drinks. I really appreciate the always full water pitchers they have available, its nice not to have to ask for refills all the time.

Love the outside patio area and the ample room between tables, I never feel like I am intruding in people's personal space as I am walking around the place.
author: Alissa C.

description:
Sure the chicken-pesto sandwich and the pear salad are spectacular.  The coffee is good, the choice of chai options is refreshing.
But the real prize here are the staff.

Because of its close proximity to the hospital, we bring rehab patients here on a regular basis to practice speech, swallowing, calculation, walking with a cane, wheelchair mobility . . . and much more.  Rather than being impatient, awkward or otherwise inappropriate, the staff here are pleasant, normal and manage to do their part to make every interaction as seamless as possible.  They act like it's the most natural thing in the world to watch someone write down their order or point to it on the paper menu simply because the person can't verbalize the order. 

Now, perhaps your thinking c'mon, who would be rude to someone with obvious speech difficulties?  Or mobility issues?  Or pragmatics and weird eye movement problems?  Sadly, the answer is: plenty of people!  You might be amazed to observe how completely wrapped up in their own days people can be to ignore or even despise the struggles of a fellow human.  Fortunately, those people do not work at The Grind.  Instead, this has become the perfect trial run destination for our patients tentatively emerging from the protective environment of the hospital.

Thanks for that people.  And thanks for the fresh, healthy food - a divinity inspired meal for someone who's been eating hospital food for weeks on end.  And a better-than-average breakfast/lunch for the rest of us.
author: Ravena F.

description:
Seemed like a great neighbourhood space to linger on off peak hours (I imagine it's PACKED for the commuter rush). Pricing was very reasonable.

Quite a big food menu. Wonderful selection of cakes and pastries- each of which had a visible ingredient list which I appreciated.

As for the items I consumed during my two trips:
The mocha and latte were incredibly well balanced, smooth and packed a good punch of caffeine. Delightful.
Spicy chai - one of the best I've ever had.
Banana bread- addictive, though I prefer mine with walnuts
Blueberry danish- flaky, creamy with plenty of juicy blueberries.

Presentation was also very good for each of the items I tried and of those I saw emerging from the kitchen.

No pretensions, just solidly delicious consumables.
author: Sarah M.

description: Hamburgers were classic. Right in my neighborhood and I have never been here before. Really enjoyed the food. Going back to try Rueben and Waffles. The fries were a little limp, but that is not their fault. California requires they constantly change the grease, but old grease makes the crispiest fries. New grease makes soggy fries. Staff really friendly and polite.
author: Blair C.

description: Great weekend hangover spot! The line can be long and the tables full, but it usually clears out by the time you order. On the weekends it's not a good place to sit and chill on you laptop, but ok during the week.
author: Tim R.

description:
Get the bbq pulled pork sandwich! I could leave it at that but there are other good things I should say about this place.

Fast wi-fi, great coffee, and very good vegan banana bread! I also love their bagel sandwiches, my favorite is the cream cheese, sprout, tomato, and onion! So good!
author: Andrea P.

description: Today is my third week in a row coming to this place. I had been here before so when the first couple times I felt so underwhelmed I figure they might be having an off week or two- nope I was wrong apparently this is the standard. All three week the table were dirty even when I wasn't that crowd. I felt the need to clean- I wanted to clean the whole thing.There were flies, the staff talked some much to each other I felt like I was bothering them to order. I asked for a glass to get water a couple times before they were replenished, don't even look at the floor of a place serving food. It's kinda weird because I felt disgusted having to eat there- it felt dirty. The food was ok at best but even that could be forgivable if the actual restaurant did not feel so dingy. After three opportunities to redeem the cleanliness and service- epic fail, not likely to venture back or recommend the place.
author: Carl W.

description: Cinnamon and nutmeg and vanilla drenched croissant French toast!  To die for.  Sat next to some really annoying kids though, one of the girls was such a down-and-out aspiring actress who couldn't get a break (boo-hoo).  The trio made repeated loud pronouncements about the merits or demerits of LA vs San Francisco and Franklin Village and...argh...ruined my digestion.  But that's not The Grind Cafe's fault is it?  Moral of the story: order that f'in croissant french toast...now.
author: Delan B.

description:
I already think this place is over priced for what it is and it really doesn't help the fact they have poor customer service. I met my friend here today for brunch and ordered a chicken ceasar salad. We were waiting for a little bit, probably 7 to 10 which is normal, then her food came. I was still waiting for mine. I gave them another few minutes and still nada. I don't want to be a jerk, but how hard it is to make a salad? Even Toby Young would agree with me. A salad that takes more than 20 minutes to make has to be a fuckin good gourmet salad. This is just a regular chicken ceasar, nothing gourmet about it nor it is made with liquid nitrogen and other fancy shit. 

So I came to the counter and asked the girl who took my order to check on it, and she just brushed me off. She said they were busy and told me to wait for another couple minutes. I don't have a problem with being a little patient. I'm not one of those assholes who need to get what they want right that second, but the fact that she didn't even take the time to go to the kitchen and checked real quick, that what turned me off the most. I have worked at a restaurant before and I still work in customer service business. Following through a customer's concern is just one of the things you should've known! It's not that hard to take 5 steps to the kitchen and asked the Cook. If you're busy, ask your co-worker to do so. Come one people, am I the only one with common sense?

Sure enough, after I had waited for another 10 minutes, my food still hasn't come. My friend almost finished with her food, and I just lost my appetite. I came back to the counter and just asked for my money back. Of course, they were just busy trying to figure out what happened. Honestly, I do not give a shit what happened. I gave you the opportunity to do so 10 minutes ago! 

Needless to say, I've had enough with you!
author: Perry S.

description: This is a solid breakfast spot in the lower Haight. It's inexpensive and they cook your food properly. If you order a poached egg you'll get a perfectly cooked poached egg. Their coffee drinks are prepared well and not overly sweet. The crowd and atmosphere are both unpretentious. I think this place gives you the most bang for your buck. One of my favorite breaky spots.
author: Amybeth O.

description:
Yes I am a fan of the Grind cafe!!  I am even becoming a regular.  I like there espresso drinks, like the latte or cappuccino.  They have amazing bagels and my most recent fav is the chicken salad bagel with lettuce and sprouts... yummy!

They just got a brand new menu and it has even more yummy options and it looks clean and easy to read.

The only thing that I did not like very much is the bagel with egg and sausage.  It was not special at all and even reminded me of something you'd get from McDonald's or Denny's.  Not gonna get that again.

The service is great!  I feel like the girls behind the counter are really sweet and I would even have fun partying with them outside the cafe.  Check it out.
author: Elisabeth B.

description: Awesome place to stop for breakfast. Went here on my b-day morning before a hike and had a delicious scramble with toast. My mouth is watering just thinking of it. Nice seating outside for people watching, and the wait isn't too long for the good eats.
author: Manda S.

description:
The Grind is my home office and favored Lower Haight eatery.  Good food, good pricing and a comfortable place make it a must for me everyday.  The staff is uber friendly and they are always smiling (Andrea and C-Sha and Smashly are da best).  

Free and reliable wi-fi, well placed power outlets, breakfast and burgers, chili and smoothies, home made iced tea and lemonade and coffee make it even better.  Busiest times are lunchtime and weekend brunch (damn you Kaiser!)

Open until 8PM during the week.  Current new discovery has been the chili oddly enough.  Ole Reliable dish:  Grind Combo with French Toast (holla for the Challah) and home fries.
author: Naeem N.

description:
Decent food for a slightly too high price.
The front of the house staff is super chill.  You get "real person" vibes from them.

Somehow even though I always clarify how I want my order, and the front of house person always explains to the kitchen, they still almost always get it wrong.
author: Tom L.

description:
The Grind is a fantastic multi-purpose cafe.  What do I mean multi-purpose cafe?  It's good for hangover breakfasts (get a breakfast burrito), business meetings, casual lunch dates, coffee, coffeeshop working, and anything else you might want to do in a cafe.  

The WiFi is free and quick.  The employees are always cheerful.  The food is always awesome.  

The only thing I would warn: everyone knows how damn good the brunch food is.  If you go on Saturday or Sunday around brunch time, don't be in a hurry.
author: Christopher S.

description: I have been to tons of breakfast joints around California and especially in San Francisco. This has got to be in top worst I have been to in San Francisco. I think if your going advertise something for price that it is, then why charge twice the price!? I had the two eggs special with has towns and choice of toast. I understand that you have a lot people come in who may be tourist and who may be locals, but does not mean you should reduce the quality of the meal at any expense, especially if your a popular joint. I knew coming here would be ok because I never heard anything too bad Bout it, but after my experience there I was left with a the growling feeling in my stomach and it was not from hunger to say the least.
author: AJ V.

description:
People call in orders for pick up ... Not to fall in line and have their food turn cold 10 mins later.
I live and work around the area, loved this place with a sure shot go to selection on the menu. My co workers and I would usually call an order in expecting it to be ready when they say "see you in 15 mins", and usually it is. There is no "pick up only" counter but usually the guys behind it would say "pick up? I can ring you up".
Except these (Daria looking - described by another reviewer) girls behind the cashier who doesn't grasp the concept of calling orders in. I asked to pick up an order I called in 15 mins prior , she huffed at me and said ... "I guess i can squeeze you in".  Confronted with this attitude, I repeated that I was just picking up but she rather have me wait in line, while people in front of me took their sweet time picking what they want from the menu asking her recommendations. Really ... ring me up while they choose between white or wheat! 
10 mins later ... Hot pastrami turned into cold cuts, hot soup into gazpacho and crispy fries into mashed potatoes. 
"Thanks for waiting" she says ... No thank you for spending half of my lunch hour because you have no concept of customer service.
My workplace holds about 1500 employees and order at least twice a week here ... I will make sure to spread this experience.
author: E U.

description: We are from the East Coast and stayed with some friends of our right around the corner.  Being from the East... we woke up WAY before our friends did!
